Reviews.Title: “Pretty average”
Reviews.Author: PVH1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in a studio room at the end of our 2 week visit. Room was a little tired, overlooking a grim internal courtyard (although we did ask for a quiet room & this fitted the bill). 5 minutes from Darling Harbour in a busy tourist area with easy access to all the sites, although we stayed down in the Rocks on our last visit & preferred that end of town. Good in-room wi-fi strength, helpful staff but overall pretty average, more serviced apartments style than hotel I think.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms for family stay...”
Reviews.Author: Fourkiwis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson for four nights after disembarking from a short cruise on Dawn Princess and were pleasantly surprised by the size of the 2 queen bed room. Plenty of room for the four of us and handy facilities right in the busy part of central Sydney with George St.,Darling Harbour, Chinatown, Paddy's Market and all transport options right on your doorstep. Rooms can be pretty noisy with street noise late into the night but I guess you would expect this right downtown and I always take earplugs when travelling so sleeping was no problem. Staff were very friendly, helpful and professional. Rooms are a little tired and probably ready for a spruce up but overall we were more than happy with the Radisson and the price was exceptionally competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location easy access to Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: CC61
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend here and we were pleasantly surprised at service and standard of accomodation. A short stroll to the vibrant Darling Harbour area, enjoyed a great meal overlooking the water. On arrival we were upgraded to a lovely King suite enjoyed the beautiful buffet brekky. Staff were wonderfuly friendly and welcoming. Overall a great stay, thanks Radisson!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the standard expected from Radisson”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: A great location for the tourist trap that is Darwin Harbour but not so good for the CBD (Central Business District). This hotel has one very serious let-down; whilst the suites are spacious, they are very very tired. I stayed here with a colleague so I got to see two very different 1 bed suites. Mine was well layed out however 2 of the three windows were in the bedroom so the living and kitchen areas were very gloomy which, combined with the tired look made the room feel very depressing. My colleagues room had very strange layout and there was a strong stale tobacco smell in the bathroom coming from elsewhere in the building, plus his view was of an internal courtyard - not very appealing. That being said, this hotel would be OK for a short weekend break where the only need is for a bed to sleep in, but as a hotel to live and work out of for a week this was so bad we moved to another Radisson property (the Radisson Blu, Sydney Harbour - WAY better!). The Breakfast Buffet was OK, but again not to the normal high standard that I expect from the chain. The outstanding plus was the staff, they could not have been more professional.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, nice service”
Reviews.Author: agentenzo
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Australia. We stayed there for 6 nights in Feb 2012 on a business trip. The room was great! It is prohibited to smoke in the room, so we were given a one bedroom suite with balcony which is very comfy. There were also minor problem with the bathroom, but the engineering staff quickly finished it (I consider 15 minutes to be quick). The only downside is that there were no variation at all for the breakfast. We took the room with breakfast package so it was kinda boring having exactly the same breakfast for 1 week.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, well-located, good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: NigelTurner
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the start, and 3 nights at the end of our 3 weeks in Australia in Feb/March 2012. We arrived mid-morning after our 24-hour flight from the UK and were delighted that our room was available immediately - no fuss checking in. The staff were immensely friendly and helpful throughout both stays. We left a bag at the hotel for about 2 weeks, and on our return the bag had already been placed in our room prior to our arrival. The hotel is a few minutesâ€™ walk from Town Hall station with direct trains to the airport, and Circular Quay. It is very close to Darling Harbour, and on the edge of Chinatown with lots of restaurants (also quite a number of Spanish and Thai places to eat). A monorail station is nearby too. The main shopping area around George Street, including the Queen Victoria Building is just a bit further along from Town Hall station. We had a laptop with us and a real bonus was wired internet access in the room, which was free. There was also free wifi in the cafÃ©/bar/restaurant area. We were at the back of the hotel which was quiet. We overlooked the back of apartment blocks â€“ not a great view, but we werenâ€™t expecting one given the hotelâ€™s street location. The room had a kitchenette area, which was a bit redundant as, while there was a hob, there were no pans and you clearly werenâ€™t expected to cook. However, this meant that there was plenty of room to make tea/coffee and also a good-sized fridge which held several bottles of wine (in our case). We also fixed our own breakfast some mornings. The room was clean, the shower-room a good size and modern, and the air-con OK. Unless you compare it with really top of the range, this was an excellent hotel and we would certainly go back if we ever manage to return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for kids”
Reviews.Author: Jonas C
Reviews.Content: Great location within 5-10 minutes walk of Darling Harbor. For the kids, its only a 5-8 minute walk to an awesome, free, outdoor playground with water area. Loads of good restaurants. The hotel room was in good condition. Loads of space. Interior was a little bland and the view was poor. Close to the 555 bus which gives you free transport to Circular Quay during their restricted times of operation. Grocery store is only 2 blocks away. But overall, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Donna B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on my husbands first trip to Sydney. It's proximity to all things that are world renowned is incredible, the service friendly and helpful, food options in the immediate vicinity are countless and the price we paid was outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Neal&Donna
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Sydney and Australia and of the hotels we stayed at this was our least favourite. Although we were made very welcome at the hotel with the girls on reception being very helpful throughout there is something not Radisson like about the hotel its more like a selection of serviced apartments than a hotel. The room was quite comfortable although very noisy with the balcony doors appearing to block out no noise from what turned out to be a very busy side street. The 'kitchen facilities' in the room are pointless as there is no crockery although the restaurant in the hotel could be used for a nice breakfast. We used the indoor pool once as it was very cold and along with the spa and the changing rooms appeared dirty and not really wanted by the hotel, and needed some maintenance. Location wise the hotel was a bit of a walk from Opera House / Bridge but close to Darling Harbour for restaurants. The area immediately around the hotel was a bit scruffy and felt more like being in London than Sydney. If we were to return to Sydney we wouldnt stay here again and would be more inclined to spend more for a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: domingofan_12
Reviews.Content: We thought this hotel was great for a family of four (two adults and two teenagers). Our boys had a separate bedroom, which consisted of twin beds, and they also had their own bathroom. The master bedroom was spacious, and had an en suite bathroom. The living area was smallish, but, you're in Sydney! You don't want to spend time in the room! :) The kitchen and dining area were ample, and I liked the fact that we had a nice sized refrigerator in which to store drinks, and I was able to make tea in the morning before going to breakfast. The staff was very helpful and friendly, and the location was excellent. We were able to walk to many sights and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “hotel close to main shopping area”
Reviews.Author: mariondp
Reviews.Content: hotel is down side road but close to shops and 15 mins walk to Darling Harbour. the staff were very friendly and helpful. the rooms were a good size but the kitchen area which consisted of electric hob is very tired and no equipment was provided. the kettle and fridge were very useful. the shower room was a very good size and very clean. the indoor swimming pool is a good size and clean but the showers and toilets are in very poor condition and one of the doors has a large hole in it where it has rotted away. the sauna seats looked very stained and needed renovating.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located”
Reviews.Author: BrazucaMiami
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel to stay only one night before return to USA after a cruise with Sun Princess. The location is excellent. The hotel is 5 minutes from Chinatown (on foot) and 10 minutes from the QVC shopping. We arrived at hotell from the airport at 04:00 PM and check in was fast and they gave us a "business suite". The suite was very large with two different spaces : a living room with a 32 "LCD TV ( international cable connected) two sofas and a desk where the internet connection was wired. Also a large balcony and a mini kitchen with refrigerator and a Nespresso machine with 4 capsules of coffee to choose. Also had a safe. In the bedroom had another 32 "LCD TV (with international TV stations), clock radio with ipod connection and a good bed with five pillows to choose. Very comfortable!! As we could not use the wireless connection of the room (Ipad) we use the hotel business center (free) which is open 24 hours. Unfortunately we do not reserve the hotel with breakfast and decided to look at the buffet breakfast room before we paid . We were not delighted .Than we decided to go out side and get breakfast in the street what cost us half the value and it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and spacious appartment near Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: zorro-plata
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Sydney quite a few times, of recent years, and particularly like staying near Darling Habour and Chinatown. On a few trips, including this last one, the family has come along (my wife and two girls) for a bit of a holiday while I work. We have stayed in apartments in this area before -- the previous time was at Metro Apartments on Sussex, which we enjoyed for the space and laundry facilities, but also found a bit grubby. So this time I thought we would look for an apartment that is a bit more upmarket. Which is how we ended up in a 97m-squared 2-bedroom apartment at the Radisson for on week (our previous house was smaller). I must say that hotel rooms near Darling Harbour in February are not cheap, and we payed something like $500 per night for the room. But it was certainly nice to have a separate bedroom for the kids, and two tv's that they could glue themselves to at will. The kitchen facilities are good -- though the fridge had the usual stock of overpriced drinks that I had to move out as a first thing, and the pots and pans were barely workable. There were two decent shower rooms, one with bath. On the down side: the beds were not that comfortable -- one of the kid's beds was so uncomfortable (it had obviously been jumped on and the springs stuck through) that one daughter could not sleep well. And there were no laundry facilities (except the usual ridiculously priced hotel service). The decor in the room was fine, if dated. And the noise from outside was constant, and particularly noticeable at night. We had a back-facing room, so all the air-conditioning units on surrounding buildings added to the cacophony. I think that's a part of staying in downtown hotels the world over -- but better sound proofing would not go amiss. But we really enjoyed the convenient location -- easy to get to transport and restaurants. And the cleaning staff were fantastic, helping us with little things. The (wired) broadband was fast, and adequate for our needs -- but I would have preferred WIFI. We used the 1st floor indoor pool quite often, especially the kids. Good job we are from New Zealand and are used to cold water -- because the pool was not warm. I think Australians would put a toe in, and decide to leave it. So overall, we had an enjoyable stay for the great location, good room size, and general pleasure of hanging out in Sydney. Not so good was the price, poor beds, and noise. We decided that we would probably not stay there again -- perhaps a smaller and cheaper room would be more enjoyable overall. But finding a decent serviced apartment round Darling Harbour is not that easy. i see that the Radisson describes itself as 'Luxurious Hotel Rooms'. I would not say that -- I've seen luxurious, and the Radisson is only that in the the industrial hotel sense, not the pampered body and mind sense.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, but needs sound proofing!”
Reviews.Author: MrsWoodie
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel with our friends who were visiting us in Australia from the UK. We got a great price and picked the hotel because of its location being near Darling Harbour. We arrived at the hotel and was checked in quickly and efficiently, although we did have to pay an extra $30 per night for a roll away bed for our daughter, which we were not advised of at booking. The hotel is clean and the rooms are very spacious, we had a 1 bedroom suite which was more than adequate for the 3 of us, the bathrooms were a little dated, but they were clean and suffice. Hubby and daughter used the pool and said it was very cold, but it is still very good to have such a facility in a reasonably priced city hotel. The location of the hotel is perfect, you cannot see the harbour from the hotel, but it is only a 5-10 minute walk, for the price this is great. Our only issue with the hotel was the noise, we were in a room that overlooked the street and the windows may aswell not have been there, it was so loud we could hardly sleep, the hotel really needs to address and upgrade the windows in these rooms, our friends had a room in a different part of the hotel and they had no issues, so if you are considering this hotel please ask for a room not overlooking the street, the view out of the other rooms are not very nice as it overlooks a run down old building with a grotty looking pool, however at least you will be able to sleep. We were only here for 2 nights, so we put up with it, but if you are planning on staying longer then please consider this factor. Staff were great and very helpful, and overall we were very pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We got a nice upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Lauren2306
Reviews.Content: We booked a studio with two queen beds and got an upgrade to a two bedroom suite with a kitchen. That was very nice, we made our own breakfast. Nearby was a large supermarket. There was no wifi in the hotel, but we had free internet access in our room. The location was also good. Opposite to the hotel were two nice tapas restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “What has Australia got against wifi?”
Reviews.Author: glasshalffull123
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, nice staff and good value by booking through a website in advance. But what has Australia got against wifi? It is so hard to find it and to get it in sufficiently good bandwidth. This hotel does not have it in the rooms at all and the service in the lobby was very weak and slow and not suitable for downloads. I have noticed this in other places in Australia too. Do they know what the rest of the world is doing?

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: peteandcarolbrisbane
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a short weekend break, it is close to darling harbour and the rocks, the breakfast menu was fantastic, room was large and comfortable. The staff were helpful...

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly staff and terffic location”
Reviews.Author: Julie J
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in a spacious room with two queen beds, with a small balcony, which was perfect for 2 adults and one 5 year child. The meals at the restaurant were great value for money and they catered for our child particularly well with a $12 menu. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the indoor pool on numerous occassions. I think the photos on the website are accurrate and overall the hotel delivered on all counts. We'd return and I've already recommended it to someone in my office.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service but terrible outlook”
Reviews.Author: stod100
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here and the front desk ladies fantastic, fabulous 5 minute walk to Darling Harbour with all its cafe's... Downside is our room on a corner and both outlooks were very manky buildings with tennis courts covered in litter and broken bottles etc. Very claustrophobic as couldn't pull wooden blinds up. Still worthwhile due to location and Sydney too fabulous a place to be sitting in room. Surfed at Manly and Bondi and went to Aquarium and Wildlife Park in Darling Harbour with kids, all much better than expected. Will review these as well.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Liv_in_0z
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a twin room which was very spacious and consisted of two double beds. The room was very spacious and the beds were incredibly comfortable. The bathroom was also quite large, and even had a separate mirror, bench and chair to do your make up at, rather than just a hand sink. It was a lovely touch! Found the staff to be very friendly. We did not use the pool or eat at the restaurant or order room service so I can not comment on those aspects of the hotel. The hotel is a little pricey, however if you can manage to get a deal then go for it! I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place, Outstanding Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: EJHPender
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with 2 adults & 3 kids (1 in a cot they provided), arrived at hotel well before check in as we had to get to a show at 1pm, & 2 ladies from the front desk came out to help us unload the car & store the luggage while the room was getting made up. Room was ready when we returned, yes furniture was a little dated ,did it effect the stay, absolutley not. Took kids to pool, only complaint is that the water temperature could be a little higher, took your breath away, but we still stayed & played for well over an hour on each day. The level of customer service here was beyond expectations, and we will stay here again the next time we need accomodation in the city.

Reviews.Title: “yin and yang place”
Reviews.Author: D B
Reviews.Content: some brilliant aspects to this hotel and some painfully poor! great service, as good as anywhere I have ever stayed. The rooms are very spacious and the location is perfect for sydney. Gym is a complete let down. as poor as ive seen anywhere. really cant understand why they only have one treadmill. they share the gym with a near by apartment block and the result is u can never get any time on the equipment. for a business hotel this is poor. nice pool though. internet is shocking slow and no wireless. again, why not? in this day and age really!!! but all in all, theres a nice vibe there and the location is great. could do with a makeover but i believe they are in the process of doing that.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL IN GREAT LOCATION, FRIENDLY STAFF, COMFY”
Reviews.Author: ASK_THE_LEYLANDS
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here twice in December before and after cruising overseas. We booked a family getaway package both times which included room, valet parking, breakfast for all & movie package. We were greeted both times by friendly cheerful staff who loved having a chat with us, which we thought was great!. We didnt have a car to check in the first time, and our room was upgraded to a suite with kitchenette separate two bedrooms and lounge. This suite was superb with all extras included even a coffee plunger and vittoria coffee, and full size fridge. The second check in we had a hire car and were booked into our standard room booked with double beds & small fridge, no kitchenette. Both had balconies. Rooms were very clean and comfy. My only suggestion would be in the suites they update the 2 seater lounge and chair as they are uncomfortable, and replace with a small corner suite / lounge, it was actually more comfy in the second room where by the TV was in front of both beds. Movie choices were excellent, too tired to watch more than one. Milk was provided for coffee in both rooms. We made use of the pool and spa of hotel, which is also used by tenants in apartments, so was quite busy. Breakfast was well done, with a good selection of hot foods, fruit, cereals and juices. Hotel stored our luggage with no probs so we were able to shop a little in sydney. Will definately stay here again next time in Sydney. Recommend visiting the Paddington Markets, and the Cupcake Bakery in Sydney has Gluten Free Cupcakes!. Enjoyed our first time in Sydney all round.

Reviews.Title: “Great value again”
Reviews.Author: KylieOberon
Reviews.Content: This is our third time staying here, but the first time we have taken the kids. We searched all the hotel deals for 2 adults and 2 kids and the Radisson came up trumps. We booked into a " double double" room, all they had left which for 175$ I thought was good value , a large room with balcony, not a 5 star but a good 4 star ( which we knew from previous experience). When we arrived much to our delight got upgraded to a 2 bedroom apartment with a huge balcony overlooking darling harbor , amazing views and space . Thisbwas our 2nd upgrade out of 3 visits , I am not sure if we have just been lucky or they just try to do this when they can. Besides all of this the service was excellent, from booking on the phone to check in to check out to retrieving the car, every staff member was extremely pleasant and kind. Many thanks to the staff for making my daughters birthday fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: cherylfabry
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for a week around Christmas. We arrived around 9am and were told a room was available but it was on the second floor so the helpful staff recommended we wait awhile for a room on a higher floor so it would be less noisy. So glad they did! Our room was very quiet (8th floor) and spacious enough for all four of us (two boys aged 11 and 16). The staff quickly and pleasantly filled our requests for dishes/silverware, addtl hangars, microwave and help resetting the breaker after it blew when we tried to plug in our electrical converter (US to AUS). The beds were comfortable, bathrooms clean and neat. Room didn't feel dated. Location wasa little off the beaten path but we got the My Multi pass for transportation and with the Town Hall station only 2 blocks away, we were able to get around town quickly, easily and cheaply. Room rate wasn't cheap but nothing in Sydney was over Christmas so relative to the market for rooms, I feel like we paid a reasonable rate. The staff were amazingly helpful and friendly - always said hello when we came in and have a great time when we left. I responded to the hotels survey after our stay, noting a few minor things that could be better (wireless Internet in rooms, fan in workout room, little warmer temp in pool and hot tub) and the manager personally wrote back to me letting me know they are getting wireless Internet in the next couple of months and he would look into my other comments. I was impressed and felt they really do care about their guests experience a their hotel. Highly recommend this hotel! Just get a room on the higher floors.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Claireantd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Radisson on Liverpool Street a few days before Christmas with my family. Modern clean rooms. Staff very helpful and always smiling. The location is a few minutes away from Darling Harbour and ideal when you have a young family. Breakfast was very good, kids had waffles with strawberries and chantilly cream - absolutley superb. I would recommend this hotel highly to families doing the tourist thing. Great stay. Good Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “We Wont Return”
Reviews.Author: chutty
Reviews.Content: We made the reservation by phone and were told there were only 2 rooms available which we took. The 1 Bedroom apartment was an absolute shocker for the money charged - antiquated furniture, a couch that when you sat on touched the floor, uncomfortable bed, antiquated cooker and when you pulled back the curtains to go out onto the balcony you were greeted with the horrendous sight of ripped up couches, old furniture and dirty clothes. Had it not been for the fact that we were all extremely tired and the studio room was refurbished with a reasonable bed we would have checked out immediately. Service in the dining room was slow although the meals were adequate. There were only 3 tables in use and we watched one table wait 30 minutes to have their order taken because the waitress said "Oh I forgot about you"!!!!! At check out the young man seemed very vague when we complained about the state and cost of the 1 bedroom apartment and appeared not to know it existed. A most disappointing hotel - we will not return or reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy.”
Reviews.Author: Chevy57
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Radisson Hotel and Suites Sydney for four nights from the 12th to the 16th. The rooms are large with a balcony but it is quite noisy from the street sounds. The hotel is close to Darling Habour and Paddy's Market. We walked by the other Radisson located downtown near the business district. The hotel looked nice and would be quieter than where we were but we both felt it to be stuffy and boring. Even with the street noise we preferred the hotels in the Darling Harbour area as the life there is more lively and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location.”
Reviews.Author: ShanghaiSezy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in a family room - 2 double beds, was perfect to have this room for our family rather than extra beds. The room was clean and very comfortable. Good bath/shower again perfect for a family. The staff at the hotel were fantastic - very helpful, especially the front desk. Always helped with all questions and requests. We had breakfast included which was great - the value of the hotel was good especially in a city as expensive as Sydney. Location for us was perfect - Darling Harbour a short walk, which had an amazing playground which my children loved. Loads of restaurants near and attrations like the Aquarium and Maritime Muesum close by. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ian s
Reviews.Content: The room we had could only be described as dingy with odd pieces of furnisher.Outlook was into red brick walls.Bathroom had no bath.Breakfast was a bit chaotic and few staff available. Was well suitated for Darling harbour. Overall vey disappointing

Reviews.Title: “Spacious! Short walk to Darling Harbour, Paddys Market and World Square Shopping Centre.”
Reviews.Author: TasMum
Reviews.Content: I stayed in business class and the room was a good size with a kitchen which had a stove top, microwave, kettle, coffee machine and a bar fridge. The lounge area had plenty of seating a large tv and a desk with a wired Internet connection for a laptop. Bathroom had lots of little touches like a shave kit, toothbrush, as well as the usual shampoo/conditioner etc. Bedroom had a king bed which was lovely! There was a balcony area with seating so you can enjoy the outdoors while relaxing. The staff were friendly and helpful. The only improvement I can see that's needed is that some of the furniture Is showing signs of wear and tear and should be replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mel1711
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend here with some girlfriends, fast easy check in, friendly staff. The room was spacious with comfortable beds, nice balcony, some noise from the street below but that's to be expected given it's such a busy area of the city. Walking distance to heaps of bars/restaurants/shopping & the harbour. Public transport close by. All in all a good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: freddielola
Reviews.Content: Good location and good deals to be had. Lovely pool. Staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, good location, quiet room”
Reviews.Author: Stringer81
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July 2011 and loved it. Bed was comfortable, room was great. Only had a couple of problems. A little bit of discoloured grout in the bathroom and about 11pm, all power in the room went off. Thinking it was a blackout, we didn't report this until the morning. Staff were great and saw to the problem straight away and were very apologetic. Ended up being a problem with the wiring.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Work&Play1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights for work and the Radisson was everything that previous reviewers had described. Had a room on L7 on the back of the building and the bedroom was extra quiet and the double drapes made it dark and easy to sleep. Proximity to Dixon St, Cockle Bay Wharf and Darling Harbour Restaurants/Cafes was excellent. The only minor criticism was no coffee mugs just small cups. The daily room service was of the highest standards.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & spaceous.”
Reviews.Author: CoupleFromChicago123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a king suite. The room was clean, modern and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. They truly believe that the customer comes first. The kitchenette did not have any plates, silverware or cookware. The hotel is walking distance from many restaurants and a free bus ride from Sydney Harbor. While there go to Darling Harbor and have dinner at one of the many restaurants. This is a very trendy area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business traveller in Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: oronr
Reviews.Content: One night was the time I spent in this great hotel in Sydney. It was a walking distance from the Exhibitions Centre which was great for me. The room had all you need for a business stay away from your office. The staff was friendly, bar service was great. I would come again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property, great friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: motelmax
Reviews.Content: A terrific welcome at check-in, prompt service by the valet, attentive F & B staff and a great room into the package!

Reviews.Title: “Well placed, well run, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: Steve_1311
Reviews.Content: (our 2nd stay here) This Radisson is the cheaper of the 2 in Sydney but is still well located and in our opinion the better hotel. It's right on the corner of the Chinatown district which means you can easily get to the monorail or Cityline trains (2 stops to Circular Quay), walk to the Darling harbour area and there are many restaurants of Asia and European cuisine very close by. The rooms are good and we were really struck by the postive attitude of the staff (and this when the hotel was full due to the golf tournament) and the ability to get a kitchen pack for free so we could get breakfast when we wanted. If you want downsides then the views are nothing special and you have to use valet parking at A$35 a day and there is very little room or time to drop the car off.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Poxyeagle
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights in Sydney and walked every inch of the city and passed every hotel in town and could not have picked a better location for access to bars, restaurants and all the sights. The room was excellent, big beds and all you'd expect in a good hotel. If you are looking to spend time using all the hotel facilities, bar, pool etc then this is not the hotel for you, but to explore the city it's perfect. Really enjoyed our stay and have already recommended the hotel to friends who are going to Sydney in January.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent amenities made up for non-ideal location”
Reviews.Author: IndianaFelicity
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at this Radisson for the two nights that we were in Sydney. It's not the very best location for site-seeing around the harbor, but it's still just a 5-minute walk to Darling Harbor and about a 15-minute walk to Sydney Harbor, the Opera House, etc. The price for this hotel was considerably lower than something closer to the Sydney Harbor area though, so it was worth the walk to us. The room was very large, clean, and modern. We especially appreciated the free broadband internet, as it seems like it's hard to find free connections in nicer hotels.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel from which to see Sydney”
Reviews.Author: munch-banana
Reviews.Content: Right from the get go, the staff were so welcoming and helpful. We arrived at 9am after a flight but after a wait of just a couple of hours, we were in a room and had also been given breakfast which when checking out we found was scrubbed from our bill to compensate for waiting that two hours! The room was huge and although not the most up to date, clean and well appointed. All the little details were fab from free wifi and internet in the room to the bathroom supplies. The bathroom had a dressing table with a magnifying mirror. Well thought out. Lots of drawers to put things in. The only draw back was this hotel does not have great views and can be quite noisy from street noise. However, we were delighted with the proximity to Darling Harbour. It is also a short walk a main shopping street from which you can get buses to the Central Quays and Bondi beach. China town and Paddy's market are also a walk away. The gym was small but inexplicably had no air conditioning but the equipment is well thought out for the space. My partner tried the pool and found it was the only downfall - the changing room was disgusting and needed updating badly. However on the whole, if you have ever heard the saying, 'God is in the details' this is a hotel that achieves that and it made our stay in Sydney extra special.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, Excellent Staff.”
Reviews.Author: pack2bags
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel I stayed in in Sydney. It was easy to get to everything I wanted to on foot although just around the corner was the Hop On Hop Off Bus. I would stay here again if I return to Sydney which I LOVED. Room was always clean, I felt safe and the staff was very helpful. I was with a group of people and when we left the staff made sure we all got taxi's (we needed several.) They had even held our luggage for us while we did last minute shopping.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice in the Darling Harbour/Chinatown area”
Reviews.Author: pwaites
Reviews.Content: We chose the Radisson because it was very close to the Sydney Entertainment Centre where we were attending a concert. The hotel was very nice-staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel is well located for Darling Harbour. Our studio suite was very large and comfortably accommodated a family of four with two queen beds and a spacious , well appointed bathroom. There was also a nice big wardrobe, a large flatscreen TV on the wall , plus a kitchenette, sink and minibar. We also had a small balcony and a table and armchair, so the room really was very comfortable and spacious. Internet was free but required a cable, not wifi so our Ipad would only connect in the bar and restaurant area where they had free wifi. The breakfast buffet was included in our rate and offered a good selection of dishes, however there are cheaper options nearby as it is quite expensive otherwise. The hotel is in the heart of Chinatown and is also very close to Cockle Bay/ Darling Harbour so there are many choices nearby for dinner etc, although the hotel has a pleasant little brasserie also. To be honest I prefer to stay in the Circular Quay area, but if I have to be in Darling Harbour this is where I would stay as it is a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: hbobb11
Reviews.Content: The Radisson was great and a very good value for the price. The location worked out well for us, we were about 2 blocks from Town Hall train Station in 1 direction and 2 blocks from Darling Harbor the other direction. We were also right off George St. which is a main road so there was plenty to do and see in the area. It was easy to hop on a bus or train to get to the Circular Quay area or it was about a 15-20 min walk. It was CLEAN which is very important to me and the bathroom was great, I loved the stool/vanity area and magnifying mirror...great for getting ready. It was also nice that we had a kitchen area if we wanted to eat in or keep snacks around. One complaint I saw often when viewing was that it is noisy. We did not experience this at all. We were on the 2nd floor and had no view...except of buildings around us. This was a good thing because we weren't by the street so it was VERY QUIET. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We arrived at 7 am after traveling from the States so we were hoping they'd have a room ready even though it was very early. They didn't have one available yet but offered us the pool showers which worked out great. And of course once we showered there, they had a room ready and came and got us. My husband also forgot his wedding ring after we checked out and when we went back several hours later, housekeeping had it for us. We were very happy that they had free wireless...very rare to find in Sydney. However, we could only use it in the lobby...it would have been nice to be able to use it in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Kym B
Reviews.Content: We were booked in to see a show in the city and this hotel is very well placed for an easy walk to and from the theatre. The staff here were very friendly and helpful and always greeting us with a smile. We made use of the great indoor heated pool and enjoyed a drink at the bar. The room was large, well appointed and had a lovely bathroom. We were only in a standard room so I imagine other rooms are even better. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Have enjoyed better for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Treska-n-Dave
Reviews.Content: We, after a horrible experience in trying to cancel a booking with the hotel, the FOM had arranged for us to stay 2 nights at half price, which was appreciated! We checked in on the friday and enjoyed the valet parking. Checkin didn't involve being told what our room included, which was slightly annoying as we were unsure whether breakfast was included. We headed up to room 712 after trying to work out how to use the lift (swipe card, then hit button). We found our room and were happy with the size. We have been upgraded to a kIng suite, and to be honest, it wasn't as great as I had expected. First thing I noticed was no microwave. Second, was that the bed was two king singles bound together with linen - and they were different mattresses- so one was an inch higher than the the other :-/ There was two vanities- one with a sink and one with lit mirror. The bath was only half size, which was frustrating. The room was well worn, and very old. It had no air of luxury or wow. We did have cable Tv, but only a movie remote so no info was available and you had to flick through every channel to get to a particular one. Breakfast was ok- very cramped. But all the usuals were included- but often they were not refilled. Overall, even at the half price rate, the hotel was rather average. The location was great if your heading into darling harbour, but it was far from QVB and train stations- which was frustrating as it was a half hour wait for the car. I wouldn't stay here again, not for the price ($190 upwards) and was overall rather disappointed compared to the hotels we usually stay in in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with Knowledgeable Reception staff”
Reviews.Author: Tony B
Reviews.Content: Located within 5 minutes from Darling Harbour/Cockle Bay Just a 5 min walk to bus stop in George Street andb a10 min ride to Circular Qauy/Opera House/Harbour bridge The room was extremly comfortable and provided everything we needed. Reception staff were really good particuarlly Tara who was extremly helpfull and used my name which is rare in large hotels but makes you feel welcome. She also found time to chat to us as we waited for our bus to the airport. A very smiley girl and a delight to have on your staff. I'd hire her!!! One thing I'd recommend try to eat in the Restaurant. The food was excellent and the offer of dinner for 2 with a bottle of wine for $58 great value for money. Its a pity they do not advertise it well as we only stumbled on it by chance on our last night Also free Internet access which was a real bonus. We have stayed at similar hotels were they charge $10 for 1 hour which I think is a rip off. Nice to stay at a hotel that provides this service as part of the package

Reviews.Title: “We were very happy with this one”
Reviews.Author: TiffyW_11
Reviews.Content: We booked the Radisson Hotel and Suites for a weekender and the staff, location and facilities exceeded and pleased our expectations. Reception staff are some of the best we have encountered - they were friendly and very helpful with giving directions and public transport options (even the bus numbers for various destinations - most outstanding!) The position is good - the Chinese Gardens and Darling Harbour are a street to cross away from the hotel. Close proximity to Chinatown (without being too much in there) provided many delicious dining options and interesting walks. The hotel also has a beautiful indoor heated pool and spa which we made the most of. We are frequent travellers to Sydney and we will choose the Radisson Hotel and Suites next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: 4kiwistravel
Reviews.Content: Really good location - close to public transport, walking distance excellent shopping and close to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price, friendly staff, nice pool”
Reviews.Author: feehammell
Reviews.Content: We stayed as we went to star city to see Hairspray which was a leisurely 20 minute stroll through Darling harbour. Liverpool street is not the nicest part of the city, bit drab but the hotel was good value ,we paid $250 for studio room with balcony and buffet breakfast for two included . 5 minute walk to China town and Paddys market , which was disappointing ,mostly souvenirs. Room was bigger than normal and very clean , nice bathroom . Nice pool and spa too and we asked for a late checkout,no problem , stayed till 12,also arrived an hour and a half before check in and room was ready . For the area , we thought it was good value .

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL PLACE”
Reviews.Author: dari53
Reviews.Content: Had 5 days at this hotel. The room was large, clean and comfortable. The hotel staff were efficient and friendly. It's also in a good location. Would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great big rooms with excellent courteous service”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Smith_2301
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an executive business class room that even had a Nespresso machine. Personnel extremely courteous, with a smile and after 3 days known by name. Good pool, spa, sauna (could have a Turkish bath) and gym. Clean, well maintained. Great breakfast buffet. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are big..."”
Reviews.Author: Bluey99
Reviews.Content: My room was very big - a hallway with small kitchenette (hotplates, sink, bench), separate bathroom, small balcony, kingsize bed not squeezed in, and desk and workspace. I had colleagues in even more enormous rooms. Everything was very clean. The good things - cheerful staff, central location close to Chinatown and Darling Harbour, free internet. Not so good - it's a fairly bland international hotel, the buffet breakfast was unexceptional (why always try to have the same fruit selection out-of-season?) and there is some street noise due to the location (late night drunks in Liverpool Street, noisy cars and motorbikes). My employer was paying so I didn't have any choice, but it's certainly a reasonable Sydney option.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: vacheezhed
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed there for more than 2 weeks while on business. The staff was very helpful and extremely service oriented. Location was great - close to Darling Harbour and the Town Hall station. Easy to get anywhere from here. Abundance of food options around the area complemented the fine food at the hotel restaurant. The room (one bedroom suite) was large, but the sofas in the living area needed to be replaced. Very uncomfortable. Used the desk chair most of the time. Kitchen in the suite was helpful to have, especially on an extended stay. Overall, great value.

Reviews.Title: “Conference was in Darling Harbour - Perfect access!”
Reviews.Author: DebV_10
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, huge rooms and bed was GREAT! And - very unusual for Australia - FREE internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: mumthetourist
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent for Capitol Theatre, Darling Harbour, Convention Centre, City and train and bus stops. There were 3 people in our room and there was plenty of room. The bathroom had a make- up area with its own mirror too. The room had access to a small balcony via a sliding door. The drapes were blockout. The staff were helpful and friendly. We recieved a free upgrade so ended up with a king bed plus a roll out both of which were very comfortable. We were there on a Friday and Sat night and just down the road were pubs and clubs so it did get busy outside and noisy. Museum Station is the 3rd stop from the airport and is probably about 4 blocks from hotel. Very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Very big rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: Atreides77
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a very good location. Our suite was massive and the balcony a very nice added bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we had expected, but nice and clean.”
Reviews.Author: Shebb
Reviews.Content: Being a 4.5 star hotel, my husband and I expected the room to be much fresher than it was. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom small, but useable (bath sheets were a plus!), but the couches in the lounge area were cramped and not very comfy. There were scratches on cupboard doors, paint chips about the rooms and an overall "aged" feel, but it was very clean. No stains, marks or anything unsightly. Being a one bedroom suite, there was a separate bedroom and living area, so it worked very well as we had our 8 month old baby with us in a lovely crib the hotel provided. Carol, our cleaning lady, even made our daughters' crib each day! There was also a balcony (albeit small and not extended out to the street), but the TV reception was questionable and annoyed my dear husband. :/ We ordered Room Service once and the meal arrived within 30 minutes and was warm and tasty (the salt and pepper calamari was delicious!). We also ate at the restaurant downstairs for breakfast and dinner during our 2 night stay, where service was rather slow and food was pleasant, but not 4.5 star quality. The location is great, however, as it is close to shops (including a large Coles grocery store) and the mono rail which we used for our business appointments, plus lots of restaurants nearby. They do have complimentary strollers to use, but they are not very sturdy and supportive of a smaller sized baby, so we made use of our baby carrier which I strapped to myself more than their stroller as we had initially planned. Would we go back? If the price was right, perhaps, or if we needed to be in the area...

Reviews.Title: “Great city base, but pricy!!”
Reviews.Author: SFGDublinIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a trip to Sydney and the Blue Mountains. The staff were great. The one bedroom suite was very roomy and well kept. There were cooking facilities including a microwave. The TV was large and included Sports channels. A babies cot was provided free of charge (some places charge up to $30 a night) and was in place on arrival and seemed very comfy. There is a small pool which was a bit cold for small kids. The spa and sauna were good and not too busy. We did not use the restaurant or bar. Valet parking was $35 per night. There can be a bit of street noise at the weekend but we were not bothered on the 6th floor. Would reccomend this hotel for short stays in Sydney where reliable accomodation near Chinatown, the CBD and Darling Harbour is required.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families!!”
Reviews.Author: Ranks4
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the hotel we were greeted with a smile by the friendly Reception staff and that friendly and helpful service was consistent throughout our stay. They were always quick to ask about our day when we returned, a lovely touch and something that makes an impact. The 2 bedroom apartment was huge, a rarity for a Sydney hotel and fantastic when you're travelling with kids. Having the benefit of kitchen is also a big plus with kids. The location is great, an easy walk to Darling Harbour, city shopping, Chinatown and the Capitol Theatre (don't miss Mary Poppins!!) We requested a portacot and found an actual cot set up in the room, which was a nice surprise. Valet parking is also pretty reasonable at $35 a day. Oh and their club sandwich was good! The only negative is the view from the balcony was very average, over a dirty roof top, so I wouldn't want to sit out there at all. But a hotel room with a view would probably be half the size and twice as much, so it's a trade off. I did a lot of research on where was the best deal when traveling to Sydney with kids and this hotel was it. I was very happy with my choice and would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Gave us a stay to remember - in a good way...”
Reviews.Author: PickyGeordie
Reviews.Content: Being long-haul virgins, my wife and I stayed here for 8 nights in February as a stop-over as we were returning to the UK from NZ. TA reviews/rates/hotel website gave the impression of being business class with good location at a reasonable (for Sydney) rate. We were not disappointed! From the moment we arrived we were treated with friendly, professional service at the desk. They were always willing to help and suggest. We got the quiet room (at the side) that I requested on the booking form. big room with plenty of space to roam around in. Nicely decorated and everything very clean. The free wi-fi was very acceptable as I was keeping in contact with family in the UK. The restaurant - which we used for several breakfasts and dinners - was good value. The menu was a bit 'safe', but well-presented, tasty and served by very friendly and helpful staff. Not expensive. The location was good for most things. Darling Harbour is within 15 mins walking distance, and the monorail (for the city centre) is 5 mins up the hill. There are plenty of shops and restaurants around, but you have to like Asian or Spanish. When you book a hotel in advance and in a place you don't know it is a bit of a gamble - luckily, this one paid off.

Reviews.Title: “Lift noise like a jackhammer...take sleeping tablets”
Reviews.Author: reduja
Reviews.Content: Oh dear, sorry to say but never again at this establishment. Could'nt work out why every couple of minutes there was a noise that was like a low decibel jackhammer noise...24/7 Thought it might have been the monorail noise.. but realised it was coming from the lifts when we had a drink at the bar. The funny thing is when you mentioned it to any staff member...they would comment.."what noise" or "we will have to get maintence to look into that". We do have to compliment the competent reception staff they were helpful and did meet our requirements with our room.

Reviews.Title: “Ok!”
Reviews.Author: Scotrocker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights before flying to New Zealand. Really good central location and they offered car parking which was great as we had hired a car! The hotel standard is what you would expect for the Radisson - clean, spacious rooms and good facilities.. My only complaint with the hotel occurred when we were going into the hotel. We had parked our hire car right out in front of the hotel (the parking for the hotel is offsite, you give them your keys and they park the car for you) and we were busy trying to unload all of our bags from the car in the pouring down rain. As we were backpacking I understand that perhaps we didn't look like the stereotypical guest but we were stopped at the door of the hotel by the doorman and asked if we had a reservation. I then had to then fumble about in my bag, in the rain, to find our booking printout to prove we did have a booking before he stepped aside to let us in. Once in, we were checked in quickly and smoothly but weren't offered any help with all of the bags that we had. This would put me off staying here again - cannot stand rudeness! Regardless of appearances at that time, we had a booking and should have been treated like every other guest checking in!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: familyx3
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel as the Radisson is a well known group of hotels and it had a good location along with having one and two bedroom suites available in the CBD. Unfortunately even at AUD $310 per night you cant be guarenteed a nice outlook! The room was spacious and simply furnished but with atrocious views, the lounge window overlooked a light well and straight into someones office window (we couldnt open the timber blinds and lived with the lights on) and the bedroom overlooked high rise apartments with most of their household belongings stored on the balconies! I booked on the hotels web site and found their follow up regarding no bath in the room and an early check in terrific but they failed to mention that many of the rooms dont have balconies or views as advertised. The staff were very obliging and service was always with a smile but the breakfast was good but not terrific. Would we stay again, unfortunately not.

Reviews.Title: “Access to everything!”
Reviews.Author: justasleeper
Reviews.Content: will definatly be staying here again. nice BIG apartments suites very clean stayed here for 2 nights in a 1brm suite and was able to visit all the marvels around great location. and VALET parking hell yes haha

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay at the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: Martha808
Reviews.Content: What an enjoyable experience from check-in to check-out. The employees there are more than willing to help you with your needs and quite friendly. This hotel has been recently refurbished and they did an excellent job. The rooms are clean, neat, with comfortable beds, has a big tv and overall updated done well. I did not experience the noise levels as some of the other reviews. Maybe you might want to ask for a room close to the top as we did. We got in on Saturday evening and the city is at it's peak but didn't notice the noise at all. I would highly recommend this hotel for the price, location, and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel customer service .......... with a cheerful smile!”
Reviews.Author: RozzieRed
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it had such good reviews, was in a convenient location to the sights of Sydney and was at a competitive price! We were NOT disappointed!! The room was very comfortable indeed and so quiet at the back of the hotel you forgot you were in a city centre. I ordered the kitchen pack (free) on arrival as we wanted to make are own breakfasts. Immediately a microwave, toaster and pots & pans etc were delivered to our room - with a smile! In fact the 'cheerful smiles' were there at all times by the exceptional staff who were all so helpful, knowledgeable and nothing was too much trouble! The hotel's Assistant Manager - Kristen - was the best 'front of house person' we have ever encountered (Recruiters please note - she is really incredibly professional with a 'can-do' attitude and oodles of charm and good humour). She must also train her reception staff well as all were way above average. It really made a difference to us to have such a warm welcome. Well done and thanks for our great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here as it was great. Eating here affordable and top spot.”
Reviews.Author: ozdrifter
Reviews.Content: I travelled with 4 year old grandson and ALL the staff were great. Restaurant meals were reasonably priced as was room service. Position was brilliant. I asked for a quiet room so we could have a nap after lunch and we got a back room that fitted our request.

Reviews.Title: “My home in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: SandeepRohila
Reviews.Content: Date 22 May 2011 I stayed in Radison Hotel (Liverpool street) few times in past and Radison hotel in Sydeny is the best place to stay as per my own experience. It has all the facility like Gym,Pool,Sauna,Spa and also have cooking facility in the room in case if you miss the home made food. Location is best, a few mins walk from Darling Harbour. Room are bigger and better with a Large LCD TV and free internet. Really a home away from home for me...

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, location and rooms, perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: Helen2606
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend in the big city with a friend to catch a show. Parking on arrival was difficult, but the reception staff were quick to valet park on pulling up. Check in was quick, friendly and fast delivery on our bags to our room. The room was a plesant surprise, very spacious, with a huge bed. Although we didnt use it the kitchenette was a nice addition with equipment available from reception if required. Despite its central location noise wasn't a problem giving us a great night sleep. The gym and pool were as expected, small with the pool being very cold but the hot tub and sauna were good. Room service was quick and tasty with the staff being friendly on delivering it. Breakfast was good a combination of cooked and continental, and the staff providing vouchers for drinks on the day we arrived to breakfast late to find a limited choice.

Reviews.Title: “Sounds of the city”
Reviews.Author: LindasColorado
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights. The hotel is located in the downtown area near Chinatown (one contributor to TA felt the area was unsafe because of Chinatown â€“ they apparently have watched too many Jackie Chan/Bruce Lee movies). Apparently, the only danger is people who become obnoxious because of too much partying. The hotel is located where all of the main attractions are within easy walking distance or available by way of the free bus that runs a block away. There are plenty of restaurants and food markets within a couple of blocks. The room was above average size, clean and well maintained. We requested a room opposite the monorail, but received one with the monorail above the street outside our room. The monorail operates from 7 am to 10 pm. It is not loud, but can be easily heard. This with other sounds of the city (that are present in all city centers of large cities) creates a noise level that may bother some people (it did not bother us). The hotel has a business center with free internet access that we found useful and convenient. Inexplicably, the room has a refrigerator and stove, but the only kitchen furnishings are a cup, saucer and spoon. There was no corkscrew or can/bottle opener.

Reviews.Title: “Easter 2011”
Reviews.Author: Lee2363
Reviews.Content: Can thoroughly recommend this place as a good value option for a trip to Sydney. Location is good, close to shopping, sightseeing and public transport. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The apartment we stayed in was spacious and clean, everything we needed was there. Don't expect views, they are within walking distance and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvabreak
Reviews.Content: I read many of the reviews of this hotel on trip advisor and was not disappointed at all having stayed there for 4 nights. I was 1 adult travelling with 2 children under 13 and wanted to be close to everything and in a safe location. We took the airport train to Town Hall station. Cost was $15 adult and $10 for a child (only pay for one child & the second travels free). The hotel is located in Liverpoool St - about 2 blocks from Town Hall station an easy walk down hill. Our room was a studio room with 2 queen beds and kitchenette. We asked for the cooking pack and microwave to be provided to us (at no extra cost) and we were able to prepare breakfasts and dinners in our room on some nights. Woolworths is located near Town Hall station (4 storey supermarket!!) and Coles is located on the corner of George & Liverpool Sts. Remember to take ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. Being near the city and Darling Harbour, there are several night spots, pubs and restaurants nearby and patrons may be a little noisy late at night. We always felt safe walking in the day or night. From the hotel, you turn left into George St and you are in the city centre; walk about 30 minutes to the end of George St and you are at the Harbour Bridge, The Rocks and Opera House. At Circular Quay you can choose to take a ferry across to Manly - highly recommended as cost is reasonable. You pay for 1 child and the second travels free. We had fish & chips in the mall (take away fish shop at the end of the mall near the beach) and then enjoyed an icecream from Movenpick. Follow Liverpool St across the bridge towards Darling Harbour and you are at the wharf with many different restaurants, cafes and shops to keep you busy for a while. We visited the Aquarium (quite pricey at $38 for an adult and $18 per child). But the kids loved the experience and we spent a few hours inside looking at the unusual sea creatures. We waited in line for about 30 minutes (lines look long but move pretty quickly). The location of the hotel is so good that there is no need to take a bus or monorail anywhere if you are only wanting to stay in the city centre region. Monorail costs $4.50 for a single trip or $9.50 for a day adult ticket or $23 per day for a family. Save your money and walk if you are able - it is good exercise and you can spend the money elsewhere. We enjoyed sharing a very rich italian hot chocolate at Max Brenner ( whilst walking we noticed the store up a side street - something you'd certainly miss if on a bus!) Photos of hotel on their website are exactly what you will be greated with when you arrive. My son swam in the pool (very chlorinated and stung my eyes just sitting there supervising). My daughter used the gym a few times - 1 treadmill, 1 bike, 1 orbitrek and a couple of weight machines - Not big but good enough - we went there around 8pm and there were always people using the gym and pool but enough equipment to go around. They were renovating their entrance but there was always service with a smile! Lovely body wash and body lotion provided in sample sized bottles as well as a few other essentials. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it for families (with or without kids), singles or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Staff Bent over Backwards to help :-)”
Reviews.Author: GABETJTBC Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Wow the staff at this hotel are fantastic they bent over backwards for us. Our car was too big for the carpark due to having a pod on the top of our from our road trip and the staff found somewhere to put it safe :-) The room was fantastic and had a kitchenette which was helpful with young children. I would stay here again the value for money and location were fantastic. There were lots of places to eat at located close and were really well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected...”
Reviews.Author: Ebby255060
Reviews.Content: I have to say, after reading some of the reviews here we were worried, but for no reason! When we arrived to check in early for my Hen's Night we were greeted by extremely friendly staff at the door who helped us in out of the pouring rain and got us checked in and our bags stored for later. The 2 bedroom suite was HUGE and clean, great bathrooms and amenities. I agree that the kitchen is not stocked well so we're lucky we were eating out. There really isn't any crockery or cutlery to speak of which is a shame. We were at the back of the hotel overlooking the old tennis court and pool. It's not a nice outlook but if you expect Darling Harbour Views you are going to have to pay a darn sight more than this place charges. I think some people have unrealistic expectations in that regard. Besides, if you want to spend your whole time in the hotel room why go traveling in the first place! My mother stayed in a standard room and also enjoyed her 2 nights here. Would def recommend but don't go with high expectations, this is a nice hotel in a GREAT location (don't know why someone said dodgy part of town, it's totally fine and 100% safe!), easy to get everywhere and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A little over-priced”
Reviews.Author: GJW8
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a two bedroom apartment at this hotel for business in February. The room was a good size but the bathrooms had mould around the showerand the view from the room was awful! The location is great although not the safest area around Chinatown at night. I think the price per night for what you get is pretty high. It is borderline 4 *. The reception staff were lovely during our stay but we had all sorts of issues with extra charges and incorrect room rates when we checked out. They were not very helpful in this instance and it has taken over a month to sort this out with them. If you choose to stay at this hotel, be sure to double check your room rates etc. when you check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: EsmeBunny
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with my 2 teenage boys. The room was very comfortable, beds comfy, shower excellent and free internet! We used the pool and spa and they were also great. The location is perfect, minutes from Darling Harbour, George St just up the road (maybe 100 metres or so) and China Town very close by. Staff were very friendly. I needed a bottle opener one night and I rang reception. One was delivered to my room in minutes. Will book for my next Sydney trip for sure.

Reviews.Title: “holiday with my husband”
Reviews.Author: DominiqueNathalia
Reviews.Content: so lovely hotel and very nice area ..big rooms and nice swimming pool ..very near to darling harbour..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good price value”
Reviews.Author: Susanne089
Reviews.Content: Business center was free of charge, rooms were spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was served on 1st floor, nice selection of cold and warm food. We very much enjoyed the location as it was in walking distance to Darling harbour as well as Hyde Park. So ideally located to walk around in the city. Nice large indoor pool... Staff was very friendly!

Reviews.Title: “NOT 4 and a half star, dont be fooled”
Reviews.Author: papas1983
Reviews.Content: l arrived on Sunday 6th Feb 2011, very hot day to placed in a room facing nothing but dirty and discusting bulidings, also to walk into a bathroom which has filth around the bath tub real turn off. Was moved from what they called a delux suite, to another suite this was better but no way was this 4 and a half star accomodation, the only plus to this accomodation is that it is close to Darling harbour, there are much better offers with other accomodations available. The only reason why l saty stayed was that it was a gift from my brother for my 50th, he booked it only because he knew l love Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “First class Hotel, friendly and helpful staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: patrick6635
Reviews.Content: We stayed three days. The Hotel was first class. Good king size bed, large bedroom and bath room, wonderful air conditioning and the best shower I have ever had in a hotel. This hotel is extremely clean and the staff was just great. I would not even consider another hotel in Sydney. Other perks free internet and small kitchen. Overall a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sydneysider2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson suites for my 20th Birthday with a bunch of friends. Originally, we had booked a 2 bedroom apartment ($370) situated in the hotel part of the building. Upon arrival we were told that we were the lucky people who were upgraded to the Penthouse suite! Although the penthouse itself was average, just like other rooms but with a bigger kitchen and loungeroom, the balcony was amazing. One of the biggest balconies of a hotel room Ive stayed in, it overlooked Darling Harbour which looked unreal at night time. The hotel was incredibly clean and well kept and the staff were amazingly helpful. Whilst telling us the news of the upgrade, the staff were getting really excited for us (which is always nice) and then showed us to the elevator. When we couldn't work the elevator, they helped us by taking us up to our room, offering to take our bags and open the door for us. When leaving the hotel to go to dinner at night, the wonderful guest services manager [not sure of her name but she had an English accent] acted as a concierge getting my party (of 15 in different rooms) a number of taxis. If you've ever been to Sydney you'd know how hard it can be to catch taxis in certain places at certain times. We were brought many things by the staff and they were overall exceptional. The location is very good; close to stations and attractions. Will DEFINITELY be staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Huge Suite”
Reviews.Author: WnnaBTrvlWrtr
Reviews.Content: Our two-bedroom suite here was bigger than some condos we've rented, making it a very comfortable place to spend five nights over the Christmas holiday. Two bedrooms, each with its own well-stocked bath, a relatively large (but poorly stocked) kitchen, a dining area and living room with large tv and a work desk gave us lots of room to spread out and the ability to make breakfast and pack lunches for our trips to the beach. The carpet and furnishings are a bit worn but we weren't looking for a luxury experience here. There is a small balcony but its unfortunate view over a deteriorating tennis court and another building's small pool made it completely unappealing. The hotel's indoor pool and spa are quite lovely, however, located in a pavilion-type setting with pinpoints of light projected through the ceiling like stars. The front desk staff was cheerful and very helpful, lending us umbrellas and calling to make sure the pharmacy they recommended was open. The hotel is located very close to Chinatown, within walking distance of Darling Harbour and two blocks from a shopping center with a grocery store, bottle shop and pharmacy. Public transit, including the CityRail connections to Circular Quay and the bus to Bondi, is easily accessible. Free internet for the duration of our stay was a special bonus, especially for our teenager yearning for conversations with friends back home. This isn't the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in, but I would highly recommend it to anyone traveling with a family, especially if they are going to be staying for more than a couple of days. The space and privacy more than compensate for the relatively basic accomodations, especially if you spend most of your days out and about.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff but rooms not value for money!”
Reviews.Author: november089
Reviews.Content: Well located central to resturants, shopping. Very helpful staff but our room was small and bedroom even smaller - no room for bedside table on each side of bed. Pillows either hard or lumpy and bed could feel springs coming through. Shower was over a high step in bath and separate taps to regulate temperature which was tricky as tap end was closed in. Not for older persons!!! Breakfast included with our booking which gave good variety and tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Poor 4.5 star hotel. Not a good hotel at all, for the money you pay!”
Reviews.Author: Patwaston143
Reviews.Content: If your looing for a place that charges alot and has a average room..The Radisson is the place to stay. The hotel is nice but no where near nice enough for the money we payed (500 dollars a night) The double bed was 2 single beds pushed together,Bath was tiny, Pillows very Poor. Location was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: magz62
Reviews.Content: Better than expected. Nice and clean, large room..We were three of us.My husband and i and our 20yr old son Perfect location. Close to the shops in George St. Close to Darling Harbour. and China Town. Close to buses and trains. Very friendly and helpful staff. This will be our choice next time in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “I had an excellent experience at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: packedbag
Reviews.Content: First time to Sydney and I found this Liverpool Radisson on TripAdvisor. I'm so glad I did! I have traveled extensively and am seldom as totally satisfied with a hotel room for the price as I was with this one. Also, the staff is very courteous and friendly, helping in any way they can. Food was good in the bar ... fish and chips, drinks, etc. Full breakfast in the room was a treat and the furnishings are lovely and everything is sparkling clean. It has a mini kitchen with sink/fridge/coffee maker and you can request pots and dishes if you wish. Desk with free internet is nice. I highly recommend this hotel and BTW, the bed is super comfortable, too!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Lesleye11
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying here and room 301 was fabulously huge but the first night the monorail passed by the window and the noise from the street, so we moved to 801 in a much quieter part but so much smaller. We could also smell cigerette smoke in our room from the air con. The gym was small, the swimming pool was great as was the sauna and jacuzi but certain korean guest find it exceptable to expel sputum into the pool - we complained to the reception staff who found this disgusting but not able to do anything about it. The Hotel is in a good positon as its in walking distance to China Town where buying food is cheaper and Darling Harbour also The Chinese Gardens are well worth a visit. It's a long walk up George street to The Rock and Circular Quay to the Bridge and the Opera House but there is a free bus No 555.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located and good at their job”
Reviews.Author: Sue_the_traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights from 05/11/10. Very well located a short walk from the Town Hall train station and to the sights at Darling Harbour with the ferries. Extremely good Reception, knowledgeable, speedy. Very clean, spacious, quiet suite with separate bedroom, free internet access, 2 large screen TVs, limited cooking facilities with microwave only and crockery/cutlery for 3 persons. Very good bed and a great nightâ€™s sleep, good bed linen and plenty of good towels. A good range of food for breakfast â€“ both hot and cold - and service was faultless and speedy. Swimming pool clean and reasonable size. There is a laundry just around the corner where they do your washing for you for $12 a load and several convenience stores nearby but with a large Woolworth about 5 mins walk away. Cannot fault this hotel and thoroughly enjoyed our stay, being sorry to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Location - Rooms - Service....all good!”
Reviews.Author: hawaiiboundToronto
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel and enjoyed my stay. I felt I made a good choice with this hotel after checking out a lot of other hotels in the area. My room was huge - it was a king room studio. The bed was super comfy and the big TV on the wall was great too! A huge bonus was the free internet in the rooms and 2 computers with free access in the business centre! This seems to be an oddity in Australia - every other hotel I stayed at had huge fees for internet usage!!! The location was great - close to restaurants, pubs and shops, not to mention a close walk to Darling Harbour. The front desk staff checked me as soon as possible, even though I arrived before check in time. They helped out big time with booking tours around Sydney. Choose this hotel, you won't be disappointed. I would stay here again if I ever get back to Australia!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful choice in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Liteh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Hotel & Suites Sydney for about four days during the off-season, in June 2010. I had found a fantastically low rate for the room online. The standard room I had was large and comfortable, with a huge bed and huge bathroom. The room was very clean. Staff were helpful and friendly. (One night, I could hear the neighbors having a row in the wee hours -- I called the desk, and a staff member came up immediately and had them quiet down.) Internet access was included in the rate, as I recall, and there was a small fitness room in the building. Really no major complaints. As with many other hotels that have in-room kitchen facilities, the relative dearth of cookware didn't quite measure up to the quality of the kitchen space in the apartment. However, I wasn't planning to do any cooking, so this wasn't really an issue for my stay. Also, the curtains didn't properly overlap, and wouldn't close all the way -- but again, this wasn't a major issue. Would not hesitate to return if I could find a suitably low price.

Reviews.Title: “no fault at all”
Reviews.Author: lexyleod
Reviews.Content: We found no fault at all with this hotel (unlike the other 3 we stayed at in Australia of similar or higher star-rating). We'd previously read here about noise from the mono-rail so on checking in we asked for a room away from it, but we'd already been given a room on a side road, so no noise was heard.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a great price”
Reviews.Author: reefdive
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Radisson Hotel for one night before heading home. We had stayed the two previous nights at the Quality Hotel Cambridge. I have written a review of the Cambridge as well. Upon our arrival at the hotel, we were greeted warmly by the front desk attendant who was from England. She was cheerful and had a great attitude and sense of humor. She was very helpful in providing some ideas of what to see in the city. The other hotel staff were friendly and helpful as well. Our room was ready, so we were able to check in early (noon), which was nice. The room was a guest studio room. Our room, facing the courtyard, was very spacious, clean, and very quiet.
