It also had a nice work area and a large plasma TV on the wall. The bathroom was also generous. It had a powder area where my wife could sit and apply her makeup. The bed was large and comfortable. The Business Centre was a bonus for me. I was able to use the Internet and printer for free. The Cambridge and most other hotels charge for these services. I wanted to try their Health Club and breakfast buffet, but we didn't have time since we were out and about and had a very early flight the next morning. The Radisson is located in Chinatown and about a 10 - 15 minute walk to Darling Harbor. It is less than a 10 minute walk to the Museum subway station. There are plenty of restaurants in the area to choose from. Of the two hotels I stayed in Sydney, I would highly recommend this hotel. Although the other hotel was good, the Radisson was a step above.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Aaron_Hall
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here for one night before our flight up to Cairns. Room was really nice and big. We got free wired internet for 24 hours. Hotel staff were good Decent location close to Darling Harbour etc. Booked through Expedia - good rates ~Â£84 per night

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Price, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pmajr
Reviews.Content: This hotel has excellent value for its price. Other hotels in the CBD charge about the same nightly rate but do not include free internet or breakfast like this one. The location was excellent as well since it was walking distance to Darling Harbour, Chinatown, and (a bit longer walk) to The Rocks. The town hall station for the train was also just 2 blocks away on george st for those who do not wanna do the 30 min walk to Circular Quay. Our one bedroom suite was very spacious and had two 42inch flatscreens. The bed and beddings were very comfortable and the room came equipped with a microwave (which was very useful for heating leftovers for midnight snacks). The only thing the room was lacking was a view, with ours being the back of other apartment buildings and a dilapidated tennis court. The staff was very friendly and helpful, with the exception of one gentlemen working there who seemed to not smile at all whenever he spoke to him. Overall, best value among all the hotels we stayed at during our Australian Holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended - Close to China Town and Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: rob091
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights, had a good deal from Wotif. Of the hotels in this price range in this area this is the best that I have used. The room was clean and spacious, bathroom was a little tired tho. The room had sliding doors opening onto a small balcony, allowing us to turn the airconditioning off for a good nights sleep. Internet was free. The hotel is close to Darling Harbour and China town. Sraff were frienfdly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: mundo61
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Suites for the third time this month and as usual had an enjoyable stay. The staff were friendly and professional from the front desk staff to the cleaners and housekeepers they seemed to enjoy their jobs and were at all times helpful. The room was spacious and clean with well appointed amenities, the bed was HUGE and comfortable, the only down side was the lighting at the work desk that could be improved. The property is on the edge of Sydneys China Town and is a short walk to pubs and clubs and of course some amazing Chinese Restaurants where the food is unbelievable. I would recommend this hotel as a great place to stay for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Next to Darling Harbour - Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: alexandrosg
Reviews.Content: Rooms were ok, Location was ideal, next to alla the bars, restaurant and malls at Darling Harbour. If you don't mind walking, Sydney opera and the pier are about 15 minutes walk but you can always grab a cab to get there. Malls and the main commercial district is 5-10 minutes away on foot. If you go during new year's eve, don't forget to go from 3pm onwards at Sydney Opera to watch the fantasmagoric fireworks on the top of the Sydney bridge. Personally, Sydney is at the top 5 of my favourite "Capitals" around the world

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AussieGirl725
Reviews.Content: The hotel room were nice and some have a balcony(ours did). The food was good. There are a lot of tourist attractions around it. Stores, the harbor, restaurants and other things are in walking distance. The pool is pretty warm and the provide you with free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent clean, no frills, value for money Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: singhsays
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for about a week while traveling on business (Moved here from the Marriott, which totally stinks compared to this hotel). + Big and spacious rooms with a balcony + Well furnished rooms + neat and clean (very good housekeeping staff) + the small in-room kitchen is excellent. + no frills, total value for money. + staff is friendly and helpful - night staff and room service (nights) could improve. Must note that the only nitpicks i have are The room service at night, which i used only once and they served cold and there was some delay. Also, the room did not have a travel power adapter. I mentioned these in my feedback and it was quickly and promptly following up by a hotel manager in the next couple of days. Definitely staying here again, on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location if you don't mind the crowds”
Reviews.Author: celusnek
Reviews.Content: We got a deal on 3-nights at the Radisson Hotel on Hotels.com for $135/night. The hotel is on the cusp of Chinatown and a short walk from the Town Hall Station on busy St George Street. Itâ€™s about a 15-minute walk to Darling Harbor or about 30-minutes to Circular Quay. We had bought a multi-day transportation pass good for unlimited travel on the trains, buses, and ferries so we used the public transportation. The hotel is very well maintained and the staff is extremely helpful. Room 211 is very large, with a kitchenette, large sitting area, king size (or bigger) bed, and a small balcony with a terrible view of the apartment building across the street! The bathroom was very modern with a nice shower stall, granite counter tops on both the sink vanity and a little bonus counter with mirror and storage. We were very comfortable here. In the business center on the third floor, there are two computers for guest use free of charge. There is also free Wi-Fi in the lobby and restaurant. The hotel restaurant is pricey, as expected in a nice hotel in a big city. We ventured out for all of our meals. We were shocked at the high prices at the Chinese restaurants, so we frequented the kebab shops. Finally we found a really neat food court in the mall at Darling Harbor. The food was very international and affordable. Dining is very expensive in Sydney. The Radisson Hotel has very nice rooms, helpful staff, and nice extras like the business center. The location is a little quirky, itâ€™s close to public transportation but the area gets very, very crowded after 4pm. I recommend it unless you plan to walk around and really dislike crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Keeps on being the best value hotel in Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: majelperth
Reviews.Content: I have reviewed this hotel previously, both times very positively. My third recent stay at the Radisson in Liverpool Street confirms my sense that this hotel is truly the best in its class in Sydney. It is often the case that hotels appear very good on first visit, but little niggles and problems become clearer as you return again and again. The Radisson, in contrast, is actually seeming better each time I go. Upon checkin I was greeted warmly by staff who remembered I'd been there in February; a small but welcoming touch. I received a complimentary upgrade from the already very good studio rooms to a proper 1-br suite; not only that, it was a room facing Sussex St (rather than the monorail encumbered Liverpool St) - worth asking for this view if you can. The rooms are big, very big: originally apartments (you can see from the layout and basic structures in the rooms), these are now extraordinarily spacious for the money paid. I was staying for 3 nights and working in the room as well - thus, a small but excellent bedroom, plus a very large living space was perfect. The hotel remembered that I liked having a microwave in room and utensils for the kitchen - these had been provided in advance; if you are new and want this, just make sure to ask (some rooms may come with them, but I suspect not). As far as I know, most of the rooms have balconies - this is essential if you are spending time in the room and want a sense of space. Mine was accessible from both living and bedroom. The hotel itself is somewhere between functional and luxurious - about right for its star rating. Certainly the public areas - lobby, restuarant etc - are nicely furnished and it was pleasant to come in each day from work and feel the hotel was welcoming me. This is one of the problems with some apartment-style hotels which, honestly feel as welcoming as passport control at the airport! So, the Radisson scores there, even if the rooms are, in truth, somewhat standard in their look and feel. The location probably suits me better than most, since my work tends to take me away from the CBD towards Central, so Liverpool St is fine; but it is not the glitzy down town feel of, say, the Hilton or Swissotel. Can take 10 mins in traffic by cab to get to, since you have to battle down Liverpool St from, say, the airport. However, it is stupendously quick to get away from - once you are in a cab, you are able to get to Anzac Bridge, Harbour Bridge, X-town tunnel easily. It's 5 mins to Town Hall railway by foot. Three minor issues - the a/c was turned to 15 degrees upon my arrival so the room was very chilly; I have to say, most hotels around the world seem to do this and, while this is probably ok in Darwin, Singapore and so on, it does seem to be a waste of money to have it down so low. Also, the sofas are not especially comfortable - they would have to be the cheapest and least pleasant sofas I have ever encountered! Still, since I didn't sit on them very much, I was not fussed. There was also only one powerpoint near the desk, into which was plugged the lamp (where does the power cable for PC go? :) ). Mine stretched to another point but, again, one of those slightly irritating things which, I guess, is what happens when apartments are converted to a hotel. But, I have no doubt, the staff would have found an adaptor had I needed one. All in all - I am struggling to think of any reason NOT to stay here; I've been in probably 10 Sydney hotels in the past 5 years and, while all of them are good, Radisson is a real find for anyone wanting space, excellent staff, and who doesn't like to spend 25% extra just to feel like one is in luxury. For me, luxury is the way staff are very welcoming, and the room to spread out and enjoy a stay. One tip - if you are a regular traveller to Sydney, ask the staff about their corporate rate; it is excellent and includes free Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Understaffed”
Reviews.Author: ann_marisa
Reviews.Content: I would have rated this place 3.5. The location was good, within walking distance from shops, Chinatown and Darling Harbour. The room was also nice with a stove so you can prepare some food if you like. There was also free internet on Level 3. However, check-in was quite a mess. When we arrive, there was only 1 person at front desk. We had no idea where to leave our car as there was no signs to show the carpark and we had to carry our own luggages into the hotel while the car was still parked on the busy road. There was a long queue at front desk and was quite a while before another lady came. Then we saw that the manager and another guy was around but they didn't bother to help out. Thankfully, the lady who attended to us was very nice, we later found out that she had to be front desk, porter, valet, concierge ... But even then, she did a great job attending to us quickly and settling us in.

Reviews.Title: “Check the fine print carefully before you book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoyboyMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in excellent location, and this was the prime reason for my decision to book this hotel. Unfortunately, the trick the Radisson hotel used to "trick" me into a "special deal" they had really disappointed me. I did my booking online directly with the Radisson. The special available was "kids stay for free". What they don't tell you is that they charge $50 for a roll-in bed for your kids, so it is not "free" after all. I wished they had made this very clear on the web site when I completed my booking. I complained to the Manager on Duty that this was mis-leading, but he did not seem to care. If you intend to book on-online with this hotel, take my advice: be careful !!!! I normally have lots of trust in well-known brand, hence I never thought the Radisson would play such a dirty trick on me......

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: snf8track
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were booked at the Radisson for our stay in Syndey after our cruise. Thankfully they allowed us to check-in early. I booked two single beds, although they didn't see the request the manager called housekeeping before we ever went up to the room to seperate the bed into two. The room was spacious and clean, and surprised to see a kitchenette area as well. The only bad thing I can say about the hotel was the traffic and drunk people noise on the street, but can't fault the hotel for that except to get sound proof windows.

Reviews.Title: “3 1/2 Star Priced As a 4 1/2 - You Can Do Better”
Reviews.Author: small-Jo
Reviews.Content: Had a weekend in Sydney for Taylor Swift concert with husband and 13 year old. Booked thru Expedia at 1/2 price for a 1 bedroom suite + $50 per night for a rollaway. Upon check-in was told hadn't paid for rollaway and would have to pay again. Girl who served us was not helpful but once her Manager got involved we were told to go to our room and it would be looked into. Room on 8th floor - which was highest level. First impressions - bedroom pokey, lounge area adequate but very cramped with rollaway (our choice as opted not to pay for a 2 bedroom). Bathroom smallish. Upon closer inspection the sheets were ripped, towels were of very average quality bathroom vanity was hardly big enough for 3 toothbrushes + hairbrushes, let alone a makeup bag or similar, shower over bath was permantly stained with black stains and tiles were not clean - nor was light switch - yuk! Bedding situation was rectified promptly and we were told that this was a common problem when booking thru third party sites. Bed and linen delivered promptly and with a smile by Manager herself. Now we chose this hotel because of it's central city location and did anticipate some noise, but even on the 8th floor with earplugs it was still loud enough to keep you awake at 3am on Saturday morning and again on Sunday. Sunday night things quitened down a lot earlier. Housekeeping was hit and miss - first day fine, but despite housekeeper asking what time would be suitable for do room when she saw us coming in after breakfast around 10am, it was not done between 11am - 1.30pm when we were out. Around 2pm a knock - told her not to bother but she gave us fresh towels. Was impressed with their conservation efforts - sheets not changed unless you put a sign on the bed, rather than other way round - use sign if you don't want a change. Same policy with towels as most international hotels - leave on floor to change, or hangup. Pool & Spa - didn't use despite wanting to as smell of chlorine was overpowering - also spa was same temperature as pool - not ideal for a soak. Gym looked adequate but not utilised. Didn't eat on site - plenty of options around - just the ads for their breakfast buffet put you off - didn't look at all appetising or of 4 1/2 star quality. Business centre was an oversized cupboard with 2 computers and a printer - we waited 15 minutes or so for a computer. Did need and received help printing boarding cards - all with a smile. If you like to watch a bit of tele (we did a bit as weather was horrendous - no fault of Hotel of course!), every time the monorail goes by your reception is interferred with for 5 seconds or so - they come and go every 7-8 minutes, so a bit of a pain. All in all, very disappointed as I thought I'd researched this well. If this was advertised as a 3 1/2 star and priced as such I'd give it a 4's for everything, but at A$1550+ full price for 3 nights, even at half price this was not worth the money. Location was ideal, staff were helpful and friendly, with exception of initial receptionist, but that's the only good aspects.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: JRMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Loved the large one-bedroom with kitchen, separate living area, balcony. Got a great price through United when I bought plane tickets. in CBD, short walk to Darling Harbour, few blocks to Town Hall Station then 2 stops to Circular Quay. Clean with friendly staff. Hotel food was ok, but not terribly vegetarian-friendly. Neighborhood felt safe, had lots of restaurants, busy area. A couple of nights there was a musician playing across the road until around midnight - I enjoyed it, but some people might not.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Option In The Heart Of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: CHryciuk
Reviews.Content: Spent 10 nights in Sydney. Stayed at the Radisson in a one bedroom suite. Was originally given an "accessible room" at the rear of the hotel. Which although pleasant did not have a balcony. Was able to switch to a balcony room on day two of my stay. Second room was on the second level facing Liverpool Street. As others have said, the noise, (especially the monorail) can at times, be an issue. The room was very spacious and well maintained. Nice size television with a good selection of pay TV channels (e.g., Discovery and Lifestyle). Kitchen was spotless and was well stocked with utensils and serving ware. Bathroom had a shower over the bath. Hotel includes a good collection of toiletries and in kitchen, a pack of ground coffee for the plunger. The view is nothing spectacular, but it's fun nonetheless, to watch city life passing you by. It would have been nice to turn the air conditioning up a notch (cooler), but generally the temperature in the room was satisfactory. Generally the hotel is very clean and tidy. A trivial issue, the reception area and corridors could do with some modernisation and better ventilation. Staff were always very pleasant and eager to help. On returning home I was asked to complete a satisfaction survey. I did raise the issue of noise and received an email from management stating that this would be looked into. Overall I would definitely consider returning to the Radisson when staying in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Average, depending on what your expections are...”
Reviews.Author: LazycatMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I travel from Syd every week for business. I booked into the Radisson with the expectation that this was a suite/serviced apartment as the pictures seem to imply. Note: I had a single room only. The room was tidy and the bathroom very good - new tiles, no shower over bath. I was astonished to find that the kitchenette (including hotplates) had virtually nothing in it...., no plates, bowls cutlery, anything to cook with or anything provided for washing up - soap or dishwasher. I could get plates & cutlery from the front desk after asking if there was some mistake, however I was greeted with, "what do you want?" (frankly an equipped kitchenette). There is no microwave however there is a empty space where it would normally go. You can request one. There's also no washing machine (guess I didn't read the full description. Couple of small things: the fit-out of the interior of the wardrobe had clearly been done to a very low budget with a free-standing laminated set of light-weight draws - it's just these little things that give you a clue to the standard. There was only one cake of soap provided... had to remember to take it from the sink to the shower each time..., err, why would a hotel do that? no idea. If you go for a single room it's a case of expectations and that's if your fine not to expect to use the kitchette then, well it's a reasonable hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Surprise Upgrade...”
Reviews.Author: jccarter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 2 separate nights (Jan. '10). We had booked a room with 2 queen beds, but when we got to the hotel, they upgraded us to a 2 bedroom suite (for free)! Wow! It was on the inside (courtyard) of the hotel, so it was very quiet as well. The 2nd night (2 days later) we were not able to upgrade. This room was on the outside (street side) of the hotel & the noise from the street was noticeable. It still was not so bad, but required ear plugs. Monorail is across the street from the hotel (Liverpool St.) so request a room not on the street side. The hotel had an adequately equipped workout room & a great pool & hot tub. The pool area was clean and is very pleasing to the eye. The staff were more than helpful & I would say one of the best I have experienced. We had the $17 AUD breakfast included. The breakfast was in the very nice restaurant on the 1st floor. It was a full breakfast with meats, eggs, etc. The waitstaff were superior as well. Overall, you get what you pay for at this hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay (especially the 1st time with the upgrade). The hotel is centrally located on Liverpool St. in the Darling Harbour section of the CBD, Sydney, NSW. It is extremely close to the Chinese Gardens, IMAX, and the Wharf area. It is only a 20 min. walk to the Harbour Bridge, Sydney Opera House, Botanical Gardens; a 15 min. walk to Hyde Park; & a 10 min. walk to the Central Railway Station.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, Clean rooms and the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Cheskarina
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a week in December and will definitely be staying here on my next visit this year. The entrance/lobby isn't much to shout about but it's nice and rather spacious considering the fact that the hotel isn't all that big as compared to the others. I had arrived at 1130, way before the check in time and although i had requested for an early check in, i was not expecting it. However, to my pleasant surprise i managed to check in within 15 minutes (thanks to the amazing staff) to a large and most importantly clean room! No musty smells along the corridors or in the room and the room had a kitchen as i entered the doorway and the bathroom on the other side. I usually have a habit of checking how clean hotel rooms are just so i wouldn't have to go through unpacking and then having to pack again when i discover insects/anything gross lurking in any corners etc. Toliets were free from any smells,dirt,mould etc, linen clean,kitchen clean and no trace of dirt oh and i have to mention this!! There was entirely no food smells during my stay. I think stale food smell is just disgusting especially in an enclosed A/C building so thank goodness!! Space in the room was awesome and that space below the TV was perfect for dumping my shopping bags! Desk by the window was great for working on the whole night on my laptop although internet connection was rather slow so i ended up using the PCs in the business room - it's really not necessary to get internet connections in the room. The monorail was right by my window and honestly the sound did not bother me!! It had the same effect as say...traffic a good distance away? The windows blocked out the sounds pretty much anyway. I love having a balcony, great for smokers but i'm not but i had some friends who were and we just hung out there for a couple of hours so â™¥s it! Oh it was also really useful for deciding on what to wear since Sydney weather is so unpredictable! hot most days during summer but the occasional cooler rainy day. It got rather noisy on one night where some people were getting really pissed drunk at the nearby pub and there was the usual shouting but it lasted for about an hour or so and it's just normal citylife and being smack in the middle of a city, one would not and should not expect silence. (oh i was on the 3rd floor so yeah maybe it would quieter higher up) I also â™¥ed how quiet it was in the hotel, housekeeping was always on time and the bed+ pillows were really comfy! No bathtub but the toliet was great!! ladies would love the make up table which comes with a higher chair and a small wall mirror to zoom in on those pores and tweeze those brows!! I could spend hours in the loo!! The staff were great!! They seemed as though they genuinely loved their job and it was such a delight conversing with them!! I will be visiting Sydney again this year and will definitely be staying at the Radisson again! Did i mention it had the perfect location for shopping as well and really close to Darling Harbour!

Reviews.Title: “Very good, except air conditioner”
Reviews.Author: oldjackaroo
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, almost perfect experience. The suite is big, the bedroom is nice with a little balcony, the big main room with a kitchen, long corridor (actually the corridor was three times as long as it should be, probably because of some corner location of the room). Two flat screen TVs, one in the bedroom and a bigger one in the main room. The breakfast (for A$17) was nice. Nice location, quite close to everything (OK, could be closer, but still good). Monorail stop at the next block. Lots of places to eat around. I arrived at the morning and the room was not ready. I left my luggage in the reception, and when I came back around 1pm, the room was assigned and the luggage was already in the room. The only problem I experienced was air conditioner. The first day I was in Sydney was extremely hot (+41C), and the air conditioner regulator knob did not rotate to any position lower than +24.5C (76F) which was too hot for me. It looked like there was some artificial restriction on the knob so that the guests could not set it to too low value and overspend hotel's electricity... I complained on the reception - twice, few hours after I was assigned the room and the next morning, to two different clerks on the reception, each time I was told that someone would take care of it and nothing was done (I doubt anyone was looking at it at all, my impression was that that was the hotel policy). The next day there was a cool change so it was no longer important, I just kept the balcony door ajar during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best front desk staff ever”
Reviews.Author: PeteUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: The Radisson is not an imposing building with grand public rooms or sweeping staircases but has a certain charm in that the service from its mainly young staff is excellent. The rooms are large and adequate with (in my case) huge beds and a big flat panel TV, a fierce shower, fridge and plentiful cupboards / wardrobes makes a stay here pretty good and its close proximity to Darling Harbour with all that has to offer means you can be out of your suit and into your jeans drinking a pint of the golden stuff in no minutes flat. Breakfast was good a selection of most of what anyone with a normal appetite would need. The front desk staff were excellent, helping with a printer problem in the business centre, using thier own equipment to sort it out and even running up the road to chase a taxi on my behalf! Prices were reasonable for central Sydney and its location a bonus with all forms of transport nearby including the monorail (75 yards)

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: kschrier
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property the last night of our trip and if I had known how great it would be I would have booked this for the entire stay! We had booked a studio room but were upgraded to a one bedroom, which had a kitchen, large bathroom, two TVs and a balcony. The property also had free internet in the room, which was a really nice treat after the high charges other properties had for this service. The closet was large and had plenty of hangers. It was simply an easy and comfortable experience, especially after staying at other properties that had fallen short of our expectations. The Radisson surpassed all that we anticipated and I would highly recommend it to other travelers. About 3ish blocks from the Town Hall train stop and one block off of vibrant George Street.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: turtonfamily
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 5 nights while I attended a conference. We had a 2 bedroom apartment with a small balcony looking out onto nothing much. On opening the door of the apartment we looked onto scratched and dirty paintwork. The main bedroom held a Kingsize bed, the second bedroom just fitted 2 single beds. The 2 bathrooms were clean and pleasant. The toiletries were the smallest I have ever encountered in a hotel and given our stay over 5 days and frequent use of the pool, they really went nowhere. I had expected a laundry, but there was none to be found. The kitchen was reasonable but we could not get the oven to work. The apartment came with 3 spoons, 3 forks, 3 knives, 3 glasses etc etc but this was increased to a generous 5 of everything on request. There was no dishwasher which I was disappointed in. The couch in the siting room was pretty uncomfortable. The swimming pool was very nice, the spa rather hot, but the gym is a bit of a waste of time with minimal equipment and oveused outside of work hours by residents of an adjacent building. Apart from being a bit shabby, we had 2 major issues with the hotel, the first was their inability to control extremely nosiy guests in the apartment below us which kept us all awake until around 4am. They only left their balcony at that time to start arguing in the bedroom directly below us. Strangely, after calling and complaining around 4am, the front desk called me back about 20 minutes later (ie about 420 am) to tell me they had told the guests to be quiet. As there was only a phone in the living room, this woke my daughter who was sleeping there just ater I had finally got her off to sleep. Secondly when we left the next day (ater a total of 2 hours sleep), I was unpleasantly suprised to find a charge of $50 per night added to the bill for a roll away bed my small daughter had slept on in the living room, in addition to the $30 per night parking and a couple of minibar charges we had not incurred. When I brought this up with the desk manager he could not have cared less and told me that I had no option other than to pay their charges. Apparently I was supposed to find this hotel good value at the equivalent of $380 per night or $1900 for 5 nights. Well I didn't and I complained to the conference organisers who booked my room. After 7 weeks of emailing, my complaint was answered in more or less the same way...the Radisson couldn't care less. We won't be staying at another Radisson, as the experience has left me with a very bad taste. They really and truly couldn't have cared less.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WestCoastExpert
Reviews.Content: A superb hotel, the staff are the best that I have seen. They really go out of their way to make sure your stay is excellent. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, good value and good location”
Reviews.Author: PaddyC172
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson apts for 5 nights in Oct. Hotel was nice with very spacious rooms. The location was excellent (right next to Darling harbour) and we found it good value for money. We didâ€™nt use the breakfast option as we prefer to expore other local offerings which we found at a bar called the Tokio Hotel in Darling harbour which did excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: IECOL
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Radisson at the end of a five week trip to Australia. After staying in the Mantra , Siebel and the Westin on our trip this was by far the best hotel for service . The staff are amazing , and a special thank you to Coleen Kenny I wish there was one of you in every hotel I stayed in . The hotel itself is pleasant close to Chinatown and Darling Harbour , We had a one bedroom suite which was both comfortable and clean with all mod cons but I will definitely stay here again when I return to Sydney

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise...”
Reviews.Author: middlemanontheroad
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night two weeks ago. When I came in, I thought that the hotel didn't give a good first impression as the lobby was really small. Check-in was a breeze. When I went up and entered my room, the room was spacious, had a king bed and complete amenities. I ordered room service which came with my food in less than 20 minutes and served by a friendly attendant. When I connected to the Internet, I got a message that the first night of access was complementary! Forget about the lobby, the room I was provided was incredibly nice and I would certainly want to stay here again because of the nice room and nice staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the centre of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: fullm00n
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 6 month old baby for a week in July and we loved it. We stayed in a one bedroom suite which was spacious and comfortable. It was ideal for our little baby and we felt very comfortable. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Loved this place and would strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: BrendaB8
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, service good, staff friendly. We had a suite, which consisted of a hallway, bathroom, lounge and kitchen, plenty of space. and very clean. Also a balcony. Location was good, in centre of city near transport, buses and monorail. Good for shopping and within walking distance of Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “best staff ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: Cheesa304
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay was amazing. The hotel was great and the staff was Unbelievable. I can honestly say this was the most helpful and friendly staff I have ever encountered worldwide..

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected ...”
Reviews.Author: jaded_traveller
Reviews.Content: Booked a 1 room king exec suite. Overall, clean and well-maintained although a fresh coat of paint wouldn't go amiss. Comprised hallway with laundry room (empty), leading to open plan kitchen area / big lounge with 2 x 2 person sofa, desk, table, 2 armchairs. 40" plasma TV with Foxtel. Kitchen well equipped. Single large bedroom with king bed and built-in wardrobe, plasma TV with Foxtel. Small bathroom with shower over bath. Big balcony overlooking Liverpool Street. 5 mins walk from Cockle Bay / Darling Harbour, immediate access to cabs and monorail. Chinatown literally across the street (not particularly remarkable though). Staff remarkably friendly and helpful. I found the monorail outside the hotel to be very noisy and asked to change the room. The duty manager showed me a queen exec suite but it was so much smaller I decided to invest in earplugs instead ... They arranged a comfortable roll-away bed which fitted easily into the big lounge area with no need to roll-away. I booked with Expedia. I would not do so again; they failed to convey any "special requests" (eg. quiet room ...) and I was unable to get a bill from the hotel as I'd already pre-paid with Expedia. All in all, pretty good value at AU$175 per night (no breakfast) for 3 people in a big 1 bed suite in a good location. Have to deduct points for shower-over-bath; in a country with water problems, a walk-in shower would be so much better. One more point deducted for harsh lighting in living room (although we moved the lamps from bedroom).

Reviews.Title: “No complaints, only compliments! No worries, mate!”
Reviews.Author: bsvonhagel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, well-maintained, and very close to Darling Harbour and Chinatown. The staff are very helpful and professional. The indoor pool was nice and warm, and very elegant looking. The business centre offers computers with free internet access (but not free WiFi). Public Transportation is only a few blocks away, so the location is actually very convenient for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with my stay”
Reviews.Author: Wendles73
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed everything about my stay at the Radisson. Check in and check out were a breeze...staff always went out of their way to be friendly and helpful...taxi right outside the door....very spacious suite with comfy bed and all the comforts of home. Would not hesitate to stay here again on future trips to Sydney. Got a great deal through www.wotif.com.au

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: ouisel05
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a one bedroom appartment for 4 nights at the end of February 2009. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The only critcism would be the 2 seater sofa which sagged in the middle and was therefore not the best to sit on with anyone else! The TV's were flat screens attached to the walls of both the living room and bedroom and the picture was good although stretched. We didn't use room service but the prices appeared to be very reasonable. The pool was a good temperature and the gym well appointed. The location was great with an easy walk to Darling Harbour and the lovely restaurants around there. We took ferries to Circular Quay on most days although it was a relatively easy walk (around 20mins). I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - Very good location”
Reviews.Author: JetlaggedGMT
Reviews.Content: Beside China town and just around the corner from George's St and Darling Harbour make the location for this hotel a big selling point. Be careful when staying at the front due to the monorail just outsude the window. The rooms are spacious and clean and overall it's a good hotel to base your trip to Sydney in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: maebrazil
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly and helpful staff. Amazingly large rooms. Nicely decorated. Huge flat screen tvs. Close to Darling Harbour and the CBD. Recommended. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: A-van-the-man
Reviews.Content: Coming to Sydney for a conference I stayed at this hotel for 1 night, before I could move to the hotel near the conference center, which was a shame, beceause this one was better. The hotel is located very centrally in Sydney, which was very convenient. I thought the rooms were quite large with an excellent shower, exactly what you need after a 24 hour flight. The only thing I did not like so much was the breakfast area and the buffet, which cost quite a lot and was a bit disappointing. Conclusion; Good hotel with large rooms and bathrooms at a convenient location, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: peggy1024
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in 2007 for work (APEC), and enjoyed my stay. It was at a very convenient location (short walk to darling harbor) and the room has fridge and microwave. They have hot buffet breakfast included in my rate, which I enjoyed! staff was very helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra24
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during June. We had managed to get quite a good deal on a hotel room price and had managed to find it through the Radisson group website. The room itself was very pleasant and it had a great bathroom with a huge shower. The view on the other hand was terrible but its a hotel in a city centre so we weren't too upset about that. The reception staff were ok but not particularly friendly. The hotel only has a very small eating area which serves all meals. It is just a flight of stairs up from the reception area. The bar is also located here. The serving staff were nice. We didn't eat breakfast here as there are many cafes nearby serving a much better meal at a much better price. We did have dinner one night. We were very tired from a day of sight seeing and didn't want to go out but we found that it was quite pleasant. For every meal they reccommended a glass of wine. The room service menu is pretty much the same as the restaurant menu but slightly more expensive. The pool was a disappointment. The pictures which I looked lead me to believe that it was alot bigger then it actually is. Overall we had a good stay here but felt that it was a hotel geared mainly at business clients. Internet is also quite expensive in the hotel. From the bedrooms you get a free 24 hours but then have to pay 25 dollars per day if you wish to continue. There is a business suite in the hotel but we didn't visit that .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: lozzahoward83
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay! We stayed for 13 nights in a 1 bed exceitive suite, the room was very clean and tidy, also the bed was huge! The kitchen was okay. The staff were very friendly and helpful they could not do enough for you. The bar on 1 is great but quite dear.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: BJStravels
Reviews.Content: We found the Radisson on Liverpool St. to be an excellent value for downtown Sydney. We booked a two queen bed - room and found the room nice size even with two teenagers. The bathroom was very nice and clean. There was a small refrigerator and stove in the room. There were no dishes except glasses. The staff was very friendly. The room was very quiet even though we had a balcony above a busy street. The location worked well for us but we walked everywhere! There were all types of restaurants near us. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Frei44
Reviews.Content: I had read the numerous reviews for this hotel and I have to say there are more positive than negative ones. So, I'm going to add my positive review. We spent three nights here and it was fabulous! Staff were extremely pleasant and helpful, nothing was ever too much trouble. We booked a studio hotel room which was perfect for us - we were only there to sleep. The room was situated on the 8th floor and overlooked a building across the street but we enjoy people watching and we saw a few funny things from our balcony. The room was tastefully decorated and clean. It was serviced daily and it was great to see the Radisson helping to reduce their carbon footprint by asking guests to assist with energy saving, this is good to see in these eco-friendly times. We ate in the restaurant a couple of times, which I have to say is quite reasonably priced, the breakfast was great and had a great selection to choose from. The location was just perfect for us as we had travelled to Sydney to attend the Michael Buble concert (which incidentally was wonderful) this was held at the Sydney Entertainment Centre which was a five minute walk away as was Chinatown and Paddy's Market. A supermarket is situated 5 minutes in the opposite direction at World Square. Monrail station is very close by. The closest train station is Town Hall this is two streets away and a good flat walk, great for those with trolley cases coming off the airport train. A tip here, grab a street map from one of the airport stands as the streets are a little confusing until you get your bearings. Sydney is a great city to get around on foot as it is reasonably flat walking and public transport is frequent. Access to and from the airport is great on the train which is $14 one way . We had been told a taxi would be around $50 from the airport. However, that depended on the time of day you were travelling as traffic can become quite grid-locked at rush hour. We discovered a $16 adult day pass which provided access to the bus, train and ferries. We caught the ferry to Manly (which is a quiet spot) and had a wander around, it's a very pretty seaside suburb of Sydney. Sydney is a very large city, which is very busy and it is noisy where ever you go. So, if you are looking for peace and quiet stay out of the city, perhaps Manly or go bush with the roos!

Reviews.Title: “Basic Accomodation - Not worth what we paid”
Reviews.Author: Beanie210273
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first visit to Sydney. Although it was near Darling Harbour, I would not feel safe if I was making the journey to the harbour alone. The first room they put us in was looking out onto a wall! The second room was only average. I was very disappointed over all as I expected more from the Radisson. The breakfast buffet was the only up side to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, mediocre apartment”
Reviews.Author: peterfromtheUK
Reviews.Content: Radisson Suites and Hotel was recommended by the conference we attended at Darling Harbor. We stayed a week and wanted a kitchenette and some room to move about. The apartment has a long long (wasted space?) corridor. The kitchen was minimally equipped. Lots of cigaret burns on the 1950's era furniture. Paid $254 a night, a bit pricey for what you get. Would not stay here again nor recommend to someone else. One internet station available for the entire hotel. Pay extra if you want access in your room. The only real plus was location, and the staff was also very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Radisson standards”
Reviews.Author: Ceomhar
Reviews.Content: I was a little disappointed in this hotel. It just was not up to Radisson standards

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and staff”
Reviews.Author: jilc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Radisson in a one bedroom suite for five nights in March. There were two adults a child and an infant. The room was great and the staff were so friendly and accomodating. This hotel was great value for money and in a great location. Darling harbour was a three minute walk and about twenty minutes walk to the Opera house. The hotel facilites were very good and the pool and spa area lovely. The room service offered good value for money although as the suite was self catering we ate in some evenings. One evening it was lashing rain and the Manager ran out himself onto the road to hail a taxi for us.......thats what I call good service. If we were to return to Sydney I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: sakaratravels
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Hotel and Suites was a great find in Sydney. Although hard to locate without the address, (not a whole city bock used for the entrance) it was everything we had wanted. Location was great, close to Darling Harbour, next door to Chinatown, and lots of shopping from malls to laundry all within 4 blocks. Staff was very helpful, and very accomodating. Room was big, bright and had a great patio. There were 6 adults in our group and we stayed in a 2 BR suite with 2 rollaways, which were very comfortable. The full kitchen allowed us to cook as needed and keep the beverages cold. We had no problem getting picked up for local tours. The pool and excersise room, although not huge, were very nice, clean and quiet in the early mornings. We would book this hotel again - price was fair in a very expensive city for accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Tired but friendly”
Reviews.Author: timmacCanberra
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Radisson this past Saturday and Sunday. The service at the hotel was good to very good; staff were very friendly, and expedited requests quickly. The room was a little tired. While we had a balcony (having booked a one bedrooms suite) this was a mixed blessing, as the room faced the street and the noise on Saturday night was a problem. Sunday night, on the other hand, was fine. The room was very spacious, although the furniture looked a bit tired. Overall, it was OK. The location and staff were great. The noise and the slightly tired decor were the only drawbacks.

Reviews.Title: “Ok only”
Reviews.Author: mytuppenceworth
Reviews.Content: Lets start with the positives: Good location very near Darling harbour Free internet. Swimming pool. Very quick check in Then the negatives: Sitting room furniture very tired & unimaginative in the 1 bedroomed suite. Furniture was actually better in the studio apartement. My overall impression was of a hotel that needs to be modernised. No issue with noise [at least for us]. The tapas in Miros [next door] were good. Portions were huge.

Reviews.Title: “Central/spotless and great service”
Reviews.Author: travelforsnow
Reviews.Content: A good location with a train station just two blocks away and the monorail just out the front. I did expect a noisy night considering the location, but was pleasantly surprised with the lack of noise during the night. I had a street facing room with balcony. Staff at desk were quick to greet me and were professional with the checkin/check out process. Very clean modern room, with quality fittings. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Conference Option”
Reviews.Author: stowgray
Reviews.Content: We booked three rooms - 1 x one bed executive and 2 x one bed suites for a few nights attending a conference at Darling Harbour. The location is great, a few steps to Darling Harbour, Chinatown and the Spanish area with the monorail also very close by. The hotel is on the lower floors of a larger apartment block and has good facilities, pool, sauna, gym ect - all clean and in good condition. My executive on the six floor front corner had a nice but narrow view of the Chinese Gardens, my friends had slightly smaller suites facing Liverpool Street on the 3rd and 5th floors which seemed a little more noise effected than mine. It is nice to have a balcony which is large enough for a table and a couple of chairs if you don;t mind the traffic. This is very central Sydney so noise will always be an issue. All our suites were spacious, well furnished and clean, the bathrooms are very small in relation to the overall size of the suite with an adequate shower over a bath which itself is too small for anyone taller than 5 foot. The beds and bedding were also very comfortable. The lack of a safe large enough for a small laptop computer is dissapointing for a business style hotel. Breakfast was fine but did not otherwise eat at the hotel as there are so many option around the immediate area. The front desk staff were very helpful and responsive and I would recommend this as a great alternative to the conference hotels in Darling Harbour especially if you like a little more space.

Reviews.Title: “No major complaints as usual.”
Reviews.Author: AliFantham
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Radisson now for a number of years and generally find it pretty good,the location is unbeatable,5 minutes walk from Darling Harbour and Chinatown,very close to Pubs/clubs etc ,10 minutes walk to the centre of Sydneys shopping area and 20 min walk to the Rocks where the Opera House and Bridge are. After reading previous reviews i can imagine that if you are in some "lower" floors there could be a noise problem due to traffic and the monorail but i have always been lucky enough to be given a room higher up. On this trip i checked in late after a flight from Brisbane and the staff were very friendly,there was no one else around and the whole process took no time at all My room on the 7th floor did smell a bit "musty" on entering as other reviewers have experienced but in general the room and bathroom were clean and well equipped so no complaints there really.I used the pool,sauna and gym in the hotel which is good although i would suggest that the gym is far too small for the size of the hotel (5 people max at a time),the small bar area is a nice place to meet and have a quiet drink before heading out but i didn't eat at all in the hotel,why would you when Sydney has a fantastic array of eateries ! All in all the hotel isn't cheap but you are stying in the middle of a big city and in a great location,no major complaints though and i'll probably stay there next year. Finally my tip for Sydney if you haven't been there before is to walk to the Rocks and take a 20 min $12 ferry ride to Manley Beach,the views of the Bridge and Opera House are fantastic out and back and Manley is a great beach to visit for the day.

Reviews.Title: “worst nights sleep ever”
Reviews.Author: harleydavidson
Reviews.Content: Worst nights sleep ever How this hotel is anywhere near the top of the ratings suprises me its musty rooms small lobby and noisy location is a must avoid We were booked into 2nd floor room in touching distance of passing monorail which when we comented about told it would finish 9pm did not stop till 1am Disco booming beat music till 5am windows not double glazed so heard it all along with constant shouting people being sick and swearing....if you get this hotel on wotif special dont accet a front room or be prepared to boogie all night As for the room musty smell you got used to by morning sorry to be harsh but this is how i found it..

Reviews.Title: “Saved by the SAS Radisson”
Reviews.Author: holidayhack
Reviews.Content: We moved here after vacating an incredibly noisy apartment on the junction of Hyde Park/Liverpool St and were so relieved to be in a decent, quiet property again. We had a one-bed apartment with lounge and kitchen. Nothing terribly fancy, but very comfortable and the bedroom was snug. Although a bit of a distance from the bridge/opera house it's central enough for other attractions. One drawback is the nightlife on nearby World Square where the antics of alcohol-soaked youths is on a par with anything to be found in the likes of Newcastle or Liverpool. Luckily our room was on a high floor: always ask for one on the quieter side of the hotel and as high up as possible. The staff were ultra-friendly and helpful and although this is not a 5-star property you're treated in a 5-star way. Breakfast is fine and the pool and gym are more than adequate if not quite luxurious. As a last-minute booker we didn't get a great deal on price but after the horror of the previous place, we were really grateful to get in the door.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Darling Harbour and Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: harvblue
Reviews.Content: We booked a one bedroomed suite for a six night stay in Sydney and the hotel lived up to our expectations. The location was the main attraction. It was 5 minutes walk from Darling Harbour, and 2 minutes to Chinatown, Other attractions, including the main shopping areas, Sydney Tower and the Queen Victoria Building were within walking distance, We had a nice walk (probably 40 minutes) from the hotel through the Botanical Gardens (watch for the bats in the fruit trees) to the Opera House. Hotel breakfast was buffet style, and pretty standard. There was free internet access available in the 'business centre' (a small office with desk). The only negative points I can make is that our suite at some time had contained a washing machine which would have been a useful addition, and that the view from our room was the back of some offices and some scruffy rooftops only a few feet away. On a positive note, the room was exceptionally quiet, and very spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice price”
Reviews.Author: hubert
Reviews.Content: Very relaxing place. Nice very large room. Great bed. Adequate breakfast. Central location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and location!!”
Reviews.Author: misslolly21
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Radisson for a week and had a fantastic time. Our 20+ hour flight arrived in the early morning, way before check in. However, the front desk clerk was very courteous and helpful and offered to store our bags and we returned in an hour to find our bags taken to our suite for us. The one bedroom king suite was quite spacious and very comfortable. The kitchenette was an incredible addition and we quite appreciated having it. The bed was very comfortable and the balcony just added that extra special touch. The staff were very friendly and helpful and always provided us with ample ice upon request. The location of the hotel is fabulous. Within a 10 minute great walk to Darling Harbour restaurants and ferry. The transportation is also great with a monrail stop and city rail train stop at a 10 minute walk to Town Hall station. We are definately planning to stay here again and would highly recommend it to anyone wanting a relaxing and fun stay in Sydney. Thanks to much for helping to make this birthday trip an amazing one :) Sincerely, Lucie, Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value - couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: Moth
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a four night stay at this hotel with my Dad. We had a two bed, two bath suite which had spacious sitting and dining areas, a large, fully equipped kitchen and a big terrace with table and chairs. It was on the second floor and didn't get a lot of light but that was the only thing that could have been improved. Reception staff could not have been more helpful and were extremely efficient. Breakfast was excellent quality and service friendly. Internet access is provided free of charge to guests in a kiosk on the third floor. The location was perfect for our first ever visit to Sydney. Darling Harbour and many other central sights are in easy walking distance and public transport links are excellent. Overall we enjoyed our stay and thought the Radisson offered excellent value for money. I'd definitely stay there again and my Dad is already planning his next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Frayed but friendly”
Reviews.Author: doc-dragon
Reviews.Content: We (a family of five) stayed for five nights in a two bedroom suite in October. Reception staff always smiley and helpful. The pool was closed for renovation but no-one had thought to tell us in advance so my teenage daughters were not impressed. The failure to warn paying guests that a major facility will not be available is unacceptable except in emergency situations. Corridors and rooms probably best described as in need of some cheering up. Our four bedded suite was equipped with four knives, four forks, four wine glasses......you get the picture. The location, in the Spanish quarter, adjacent to Chinatown and Darling Harbour is slightly tatty but very convenient for bars, restaurants and transport. If I were staying in Sydney for five nights again I'd probably pay a bit more for extra facilities and nicer environs but this place is fine for a shorter break and for those whose main priorities are a central location and a clean, comfortable place to get their head down.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good”
Reviews.Author: H-Marie123
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Raddisson Hotel and Suites - one night either side of a trip to the Blue Mountains. I must confess that my expectations weren't that high after reading some of the reviews on trip advisor, but my husband and I were surprised once we got up to the rooms. On our first night we were booked into an Executive Suite and for our second night we were booked into a studio, but they upgraded us to an Executive Suite. I have photos of both but had trouble uploading, so will keep trying. PROs: - the rooms were very clean, with good kitchen facilities featuring all the things you'ld expect - dishwasher, fridge/freezer, oven, microwave. - the living room in both suites were a decent size (the second one we stayed in was a bit smaller than the first but still good value we thought) - bathrooms were clean and tidy - the first suite had a double shower no bath, and the second suite we stayed in had shower over bath. - really good location, handy to Darling Harbour, the Monorail, and shops - surrounded by some good cafes and restaurants - the front desk staff were polite and helpful CONs: - can be a little noisy (street noise) - our first night we were up on the 6th floor and street noise wasn't so bad, the second night we were on the 3rd floor and there was a noticable difference - the beds weren't that comfortable - a little hard, but hey the linen and sheets were clean so a minor complaint really - if you have a car then parking can be expensive here - I think it was an extra $26 a night and you have to pay it because there is nowhere else to park your car around the hotel

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: MPVDH
Reviews.Content: There is no way this is a 4.5 star hotel, more like a 1 star. The room was big, but dirty walls and horrible lighting. Very noisy and very uninformed staff. It has completely made me not want to ever stay at a Radisson Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I am glad I chose this one!!”
Reviews.Author: NoWorriesYokosuka
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful vacation in Sydney. I checked Trip Advisor and the comments were so helpful and true. The Radisson was a great stay. The location can not be beat. It was right down the street from Darling Harbor which we visited almost everday! Our room was roomy and clean. The offered room service daily and the 1 bedroom suite is big enough for a family of 4 ( they can send up extra roll-away-beds for $35 per night). Our room came with a full bar although I wouldn't eat anything from it (chips, sodas and nuts) you have to pay for what you eat and the prices were expensive. It was cheaper to go the the grocery store "Coles" located up the street for snacks and sodas. I really can't complain though and I would stay here again if I was given the chance. The duty manager was very nice and never got tired of our millions of questions. The waitress Alejandra took care of our dinning needs and really made us feel welcomed whether we were dinning in the hotel restaurant or ordering in-room service ...also the when we ordered food to our room it came up quick and hot!!. I did not like the meat (chicken, fish, or beef) it tasted very different than what I am used to. We loved the dessert. It is pretty expensive ordering food from the hotel but it is an option. There are so many places to eat from within walking distance. There is a great deli (spanish delicatessen )across the street if you just want a real good sandwich and soda. Taxi's galore in the area ( although you really won't need them). China town and Paddy's market is within 5 min. walking distance. Please go to Paddys's market for all of your souvenir's they are 50-70% cheaper than buying anywhere else (same stuff but way cheaper). I went on the last day of my stay and was upset that I did not go there first. So much to chose from ( silk, jewelry, clothes...ect.). We went to China Town and they had millions of restaurants to pick from (some places a little bit ruff looking!) Make sure you get a package deal tour of the main attractions before leaving....was very expensive if you purchased tickets at the door. Kids will love Darling Harbor (parks, play area and sidewalk eateries). Very expensive for dinning out and even for 1scoop of icecream on a cone $4.10. 16 oz soda $3.50 -$5.00. Loved the chips a.k.a. french fries, was the best I have ever had. Not crazy about the fish part. American fastfood restaurants does not taste the same at all! But as the Aussie's say "No Worries". Do not do the buy back program at the airport it is not worth it( a fee to have them buy back your leftover AUD$). I doubt you will be bringing any money back from the trip. A lot of things to do with your kids at Darling Harbor very relaxing but fun atmosphere. The weather was mild for winter time but it was raining half of the time but this did not stop us from having a good time. There were sunny days where we sat with the children eating icecream on the docks watching the boats go buy and feeding the beautiful birds. It is a place your family will enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family accomodation”
Reviews.Author: surfnsally
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 x nights Sydney.We are a family of 4 with children aged 11 and 13 years.This hotel suited our needs perfectly.The apartment was roomy with clean.It had a full kitchen and two bathrooms including a bath.We were attracted to this hotel for the indoor pool ( a must in winter) and the location. We had the mono-rail at our door.Darling Harbour and Cockle Bay 5 minite walk.Lots of family friendly eating locations as the spanish quarter and china town are close by.The staff were friendly and had a can do attitude.There is no view but we spent very little time there as there is too much to do.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Loved It, Excellent Location and Friendly Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Spirax
Reviews.Content: This is definately the nicest hotel in the CBD Sydney, its only a short walk to Darling Harbour and Paddys Market etc. The food served in the restaurant is absolutely delicious, the rooms are very spacious and the balcony has a great view. The most important thing about this hotel are the staff who are extremely helpful, friendly and kind. I was highly impressed. Im going to stay there again thats for sure!!!!! I would grade it A++++++. Please do go and stay there and find out for yourself its worth every cent spent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: villdre
Reviews.Content: It was a good place. Always got a smile with the service ... which is not that easy to come by in many places! The room was HUGE. Nice balcony ... Spa-style shower ... Free Broadband (yes, FREE! and fast too). The gym & pool were tiny ... but there is a fitness first down the road. I didnt sample the restaurant. But every morning, they had $2 coffee in the Lobby (very good 'Vittoria' coffee). Room had a kitchenette. But no utensils. I didn't ask for any, but I am sure they would have brought some up, along with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Great, reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vicky101
Reviews.Content: After an 18 hour flight and an early arrival it was very nice to use the pool and shower facilities, even though we were too early to get into the room. When we did get to the room - very large are with a desk, MASSIVE bed, excellent shower and decent sized, clean bathroom, plus plenty of tea and coffee which was very welcome. Good location for Darling Harbour and about a 20 minute walk to the Harbour area - all in all a very good hotel for the budget minded traveller.

HotelInfo.Name: Radisson Hotel And Suites Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 72 Liverpool Street, Darling Harbour, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
